the essay that convinced me to become a vegan the very fact that one is alive mean consuming nutrient and staying alive mean that something somewhere must die in order to supply these nutrient this is a fact of life and the marvellous thing about a fact is that one can not argue with it one can argue about a belief an opinion a theory an ideal and so on but a fact never one can deny a fact pretend that it is not there but once seen a fact brings freedom from choice and decision most people think and feel that choice implies freedom having the freedom to choose but this is not the case freedom lie in seeing the obvious and in seeing the obvious there is no choice no deliberation no agonising over the right and wrong judgment in the freedom of seeing the fact there is only action when it come to the consumption of nutrient there are many and various belief one can hold dearly to there are people who will not eat red meat at all only white meat and fish then there are people who will not eat any flesh of warm blooded animal at all only fish and reptile then there are people vegetarian who will not eat any meat at all but will consume egg and dairy product then there are people vegan who will eat only vegetable grain and seed then there are people fruitarians who will only eat fruit then a we go into myth and fantasy there are those who live on water and air and finally those who live on air only some vegetarian maintain that a a carrot for example doe not scream audibly when it is pulled from the ground there is no distress caused by the consumption of vegetable yet the carrot indubitably dy slowly by being extracted from it life support system the ground is it home and is this not distressing on some level of a living growing organism it all depends upon the level or degree of aliveness that one ascribes to thing vegan for instance will not consume egg a this prevents an incipient life from being born fruitarians go one step further and say that a the consumption of carrot prevents them from going to seed and sprouting new life vegetable are to be eschewed entirely then a the eating of grain and seed also prevent potential life form from growing reducing eliminating cheese from my diet i've been a long term vegetarian mostly started because i didn't like the idea of complicated emotional creature like pig and cow being factory farmed with little concern for their well being this stance ha expanded over the year to include the obvious environmental argument for a reduced land use impact on the world and reduction of the high greenhouse gas emission that result from raising the billion of animal we slaughter every year i haven't however yet went so far a to cut out animal product such a egg and dairy especially a i can buy some of them from a farm near my house that ha a lovely sense of animal welfare but after speaking with my roommate more about reducing our individual impact i decided to look closely at what the emission are of the food that i commonly eat and wow it turn out cheese chocolate and coffee account for the bulk of what's left of my food related greenhouse emission the rough ball park is that my consumption of just those three product lead to about 500kg of co2 equivalent being emitted per year equal to roughly what i emit from power consumption or traveling by bus subway rail the rest of my food consumption combined probably only equal 200 300kg of co2 with a lot of that being from olive oil using the data found here http ourworldindata org food choice v eating local it's a tough sell for me a i like practically every cheese and would put it on every meal in some way chocolate isn't a huge deal for me and i've replaced coffee with some other coffee like product made from wheat that don't have caffeine but do the trick for me probably i will take an approach to reduce my consumption allowing the odd cheesy treat instead of having it be a very regular part of my purchase diet anyway i kinda just wanted to think this through and type it out happy to hear some friendly criticism other non partisan source of info discussion that isn't just expressing moral to each other etc

giving up on my dream i'm currently studying for a master of engineering in biotechnology i have a dog i love and i went vegan about a year and a half ago since then it's like my mind ha opened and i can sympathize with animal on a much more intense and emotional level before it wa like my mind protected itself by turning it of got my dog a year ago about the dream i started my study wanting to research the brain and mental illness i wanted to find what happens in the brain during therapy v medication but a i'm in my fourth year i'm realizing this won't be possible without animal experiment and i don't think i can do it i have found that i have an interest in bacteria the good and the bad kind and i have gotten an internship this summer with a research group studying the plauge bacteria and i danced with joy yet this morning i'm drinking my tea eating my hemp seed toast and feeling a loss for what could have been i have my own experience with mental illness and my best friend of 15 year have battled it her while life and i wa really wanting to make a difference in the field i can't help but feeling a little weak but the thought of spending my career experimenting on mouse make me want to vomit fly were bad enough i don't know if anyone will read this but it felt somewhat therapeutic to type it out i hope you are all being safe and taking care of your physical and mental well being in these crazy time

not mean it your new normal it not just experiment and check out youtube channel or article trust me you are gonna find delicious food and learn to make it and this come from a former meatholic

important post on vegan dog food not all dog food is good some is really bad i'm feeding my dog vdog nugget after doing research it's extremely unhealthy for them to it being very inflammatory the oil in it is sunflower seed oil which is extremely high in omega 6 which can be a huge problem for dog on a vegan diet it cause a lot of inflammation and it severely limit their conversion of ala to dha and epa omega 3 and this is why after switching my dog to vdog nugget they have become really itchy and keep biting their body since vegan dog are not recieving dha and epa which either come from fish or algae and they're recieving ala instead then they would have enough omega 3 to combat the inflammation from high omega 6 intake which make high omega 6 intake a much bigger problem for vegan dog than non vegan dog you can give dog algae oil but it's not necessary it's better to switch them to a good vegan dog food that doesn't use a high omega 6 oil then they won't have high omega 6 level and they would also be able to convert ala to dha and epa sadly i have a 15kg unopened bag of vdog nugget that they have to go through so i may order them algae oil while they go through it so that it help with their skin problem from the high omega 6 content in their dog food make sure your vegan dog food is good not all are and vdog nugget certainly isn't good

how veganism helped my eating disorder ever since i wa 12 i had issue with food i always wanted to be thin but always found it difficult to do long term i loved eating and i loved food when i wa 13 i went from a 22 bmi to 18 bmi in a little over a month because i wa starving myself people started to notice and i wa basically forced to eat more until i gained the weight back later that year i started throwing up my food to avoid gaining weight i would regularly pas out when i wa 14 i came across a vegan youtuber and my first reaction wa how fucking stupid but then after listening and looking at more vegan youtubers and eventually watching earthling i knew i could no longer support the meat or dairy industry i went whole food vegan and after a few month i noticed i wa at my desired weight about 135lbs and 19 5 bmi it took no effort whatsoever either month go by and i wouldn t lose or gain any weight despite not looking at my calorie consumption and eating plenty of food i also felt happier and had more energy fast forward to today i m 22 year old and have had no issue with my eating disorder i m still at around 135lbs average and i couldn t be happier i know this probably won t be the case for everyone but it wa a really nice bonus to not supporting animal suffering

overcoming a self identity crisis tw self harm depression eating disorder general mental health issue i wa a huge meat eater i loved cheese and egg there wasnt a day heck even a meal without animal product then one day 4 8 2014 i watched earthling and turned my nutrition upside down fully plant based i researched cruelty free product and avoided zoo etc i have never felt a genuine and real and authentic i dont know what happened in 2018 but i completely lost myself i started hurting myself again i wa completely burnt out i started binge eating and purging i ate until i wa sick and then spent 3 to 4 hour at the gym i compensated the pressure and anxiety with food and exercise then i figured i would feel sick faster if i ate the lifeless body of innocent animal and if i drank baby cow growth juice and if i scrambled some chicken period so i started consuming animal product again to hurt myself every time i put something on my plate i thought about the horrific process needed for this to land on my plate it made me feel sick to my stomach this wa my new way of self harm when my own blood wasnt enough i needed my conscience to weigh heavily on me for having the blood of innocent animal on my hand after about two year of this mental torture to myself i realized that i wasnt fine i wasnt just coping with thing differently i wa hurting myself either with the knife on my skin or with the fork on my plate i mustered all my courage and finally admitted i needed help i started therapy a few therapist and med and diagnosis later here i am i found myself again i am immeasurably sorry i have betrayed my beloved fellow earthling i wouldnt say i have any regret in my life except for this betrayal 8 4 2021 i am with you again and forever

let talk about hunting disclaimer i am not actually vegan and don't ever see myself being vegan i can understand the benefit of vegetarianism and could one day take that route but currently believe veganism is actually ethically counterproductive thats a discussion we can save for another time anyway i wa having a debate with my significant other the other day about hunting this isn't pertaining to illegal hunting poaching or any form of hunting that actively kill an already diminishing specie this is more in regard to sport hunting and other legal form of hunting my significant other is vegan so anyway i personally feel a though hunting isn't a bad a it is made out to be my so felt quite the opposite she basically stated that killing any animal under any circumstance is one of the worst thing you can do although i do agree to some extent i do believe that there is a lot more to take into consideration than just the death of the animal in particular i made the argument that sport hunting and the industry actually doe bring about a lot more good than people realize a lot of hunter pay for permit and in some case of big game pay thousand of dollar to kill one animal this money is often put back into the land used for preservation purpose a well a funding security for those animal which are often poached the documentary trophy discus this particularly well in my opinion if if were not for this money put back into preservation i believe that a lot of forgotten land would be taken advantage of by big business for development purpose additionally in the case of invasive specie it can actually be beneficial to hunt those animal a to preserve the indigenous population my so however did not feel the same way at all she said that no matter the circumstance hunting is ethically wrong and should be looked down upon at this point i decided to bring up the famous ethical trolley problem instead of giving her the situation using people i instead used deer would it be okay to kill 1 deer if you could save 100 deer from death she wa very turnt off by this question she first tried to say that she would not make that decision but would rather die before making it at first until i pressed her she eventually landed on not killing the 1 deer because she could never be the person that determines the death of an animal i thought this wa a bit of a cop out and explained to her that one would then assume that she is basically letting the other 100 deer die she argued that it wa a ridiculous scenario and not one that can be related to ethic at all that i should not have brought up that situation when discussing animal activism oh well anyway my point wa to say that hunting legally may result in the death of a few animal but at the same time it could bring money to help preserve many more animal and environment ultimately then if done correctly hunting wouldn't be so bad and instead could have positive benefit especially since it is already so hard to fund land preservation and hire lawyer willing to fight against big business for this purpose anyway that wa a brief rundown of the discussion at hand i know she value the opinion of this community so i am posing the question to you guy what are your take on hunting amp x200b appreciate the time you've taken to read this post i know it's a long one look forward to some good discussion

zinc and other supplement depression do you supplement your diet i noticed getting depressed and an inability to process sugar after doing some research i found i may be zinc deficient i've been vegan for about 20 year and been fairly antisocial at time but also content on my own there's a condition called pyroluria which is a deficiency of zinc and b6 because of modern farming technique the soil is getting more and more depleted of mineral i found after supplementing with zinc and b6 i felt a lot better i think veganism is amazing but we may have to supplement in fact it's thought that are 2 billion people who are zinc deficient so it's not just about veganism vegetarianism

addressing the graphic depiction of nh animal abuse i see it more and more people post picture of graphic depiction of nh animal abuse without any sort of tag or filter these image are triggering in nature and while they have a place to be shown should be enforced a having to be tagged a nsfw i'd go so far a to say that it is actually speciesist for u to not treat the victim in these image with the same respect that we would a human when the image of a human is graphic we acknowledge the graphic triggering and disturbing nature of the image by tagging it a nsfw when we post the same image towards nh animal abuse however we often leave now some may say that one could just look at another sub and leave this one but it written well in the rule under nonvegan post gt do not under any circumstance post content such a recipe food picture news cross post and so forth which include glorify or display the result of animal abuse exploitation or cruelty this may result in an immediate ban and post will be removed i acknowledge fully that this rule exists but i feel like it is being reinterpreted based off of the bias that if the image is technically pro vegan or if the image are somehow spun in a pro vegan way then it seen a okay it really isn't especially when you're dealing with such triggering content that often go untagged and unflaired if i'm going to bring up a problem i like to propose solution to go along with it so these are mine make the rule regarding this content it own rule rather than falling under the category of no nonvegan post this would allow u to hear the voice of other people too on this including mod

cognitive dissonance seeking empathy guidance i ve been watching a lot of cosmicskeptic alex o connor on youtube the past few week for those unfamiliar he discus a variety of topic notably theology and philosophy but touch on veganism quite often a well it s fair to say that until recently i never really gave the concept of veganism much thought a most people do or rather don t do i suppose to get straight to the point i m experiencing some personal struggle in this regard i m sure many of you have experienced the same i guess i m seeking some guidance in my direction from here i think there s strong case to be made for veganism on moral ground in regard to the suffering of animal notably i have a problem with the current state of the food industry this is largely propagated by a life changing awakening i ve had in recent month that paint a much bigger picture i won t go into too much detail on that for now since it s not 100 applicable but briefly i am experiencing a growing resentment for the total reliance on the modern system we ve been set up to live by and only by it that being big industry and corporation this includes especially the food industry so on the topic of the meat industry our population number have increased so much in recent century that we no longer have a need to hunt for food we breed and manufacture animal for the sole purpose of eating them and often time these facility lack proper oversight you ve seen the video of the undercover investigation it s horrific it s unnatural so where do i stand in all of this i feel a growing guilt for consuming manufactured meat i could simply stop eating it but it s difficult to do when i m surrounded by people who do eat manufactured meat and have zero problem with it a it stand i recognize our omnivorous nature and i recognize the natural state of the world there s always going to be an impersonal uncaring necessary balance between predator and prey that said i don t think i would have a problem with consuming meat so long a i am the one that hunt and doe so correctly so a to not cause any undue suffering to an animal i also don t see a problem in utilizing an animal s resource a long my super easy regular vegan meal here are some of my quick no stress no way to screw up vegan recipe baked ziti boil some pasta noodle in a bowl take some tofu and mash it up add some nutritional yeast some salt oregano or and basil when the pasta is ready place it in a over safe dish put marinara sauce on top and then put the tofu on top of that put tin foil and place in oven french bread pizza do the same thing with the tofu cut the baguette in half put pizza sauce or marinara sauce on first then the tofu add your favorite topping chickpea taco dice some onion and or cucumber take the chickpea and mash them together with the onion and or cucumber add chili seasoning and any other mexican type seasoning you like place in the over just to toast it i like to toast my taco a little too add some lime chickpea tuna fish sandwich in place of tuna i use chickpea i like to toast so same a above but once the chickpea and onion are toasted mix it with vegan mayo in a bowl then make your sandwich pesto spinach basil nutritional yeast walnut blend and can be used a a dip or on any type of pasta noodle add tofu too black bean or pinto bean on rice sometimes i put it on brown rice or quinoa no explanation add potato middle eastern bowl chickpea or green lentil on couscous or rice or quinoa add humus and any veggie you like i also add sweet potato or potato peanut butter and banana sandwich self explanatory i put it on whole wheat toast green lentil on quinoa or couscous i boil some water add some salt and then when it boil i add the lentil cover and turn down to low and let it sit for 30 minute so simple one of my favs i always add flax or hemp seed on my food

vegan childhood memory a recent post of bug reminded me of this and i wondered if anyone had memory from their childhood that showed you had vegan ethic when you were young one of my earliest memory is from when i wa 3ish year old i wa playing on our patio and saw a lady bug i remember wanting to see what would happen if i squished it idk i knew it would squish but i think that i thought it would flatten and pop back up like in a cartoon i took a plastic picnic table we had and crushed the ladybug i still remember the sound and when i picked the table up it wa crushed and not moving and it didn't pop back and i realized i had killed it that's a far a i remember but apparently i screamed really loud and my mom ran out because she literally thought i wa being kidnapped or something i wa so inconsolable that i had hurt the lady bug and clearly it wa more than just childish overdramatization considering it's like my first memory idk it just make me think that if we could let kid make their own choice they would never eat meat it isn't in our nature to want to hurt animal at all i also wanted to stop eating meat when i wa a bit older and realized that people ate duck and that the chicken i ate wa animal part doe anyone else have moment like that where looking back you can see that you had a sort of vegan ethical framework from the start

question for veteran vegan hey everyone my family want to go vegan we own 6 chicken and i have question i saw something on a different page that basically said i wa a monster for owning chicken let me give some info and then you tell me if i m evil i adopted a friend s chicken last summer they were getting ready to move and couldn t find a home for them so they were going to kill them and eat them i wa mortified so i took them in they get ton of veggie fruit snack love safety from local predator space to roam and access to their egg for day at a time in case they need the nutrient from their egg that they would normally eat in the wild whatever is leftover we ve always eaten or shared with neighbor they re super friendly and come up to you for love and treat one person said that they should be set free but i can 100 promise you they would die in the wild is it wrong to eat the leftover egg that the chicken don t eat themselves obviously you re not vegan then but at least your not supporting factory farming sooooo am i evil lol taking care of them and getting to know their little personality ha been so amazing and eye opening anyone who spends time with chicken can tell you that they re amazing animal

i ve tried eating more peanut butter avocado olive oil etc but maybe i m just crazy and can t eat like that every day multiple time a day at this point i feel like i m too depressed to be motivated for basic upkeep of myself a a result my period became so irregular and i ve lost so much weight and cannot gain it back i m almost borderline underweight so i resorted to ordering food delivery literally everyday i don t have a car to do takeout and the spot i can eat at are not within walking distance with a mixture of grocery because i don t want to have strictly delivery i ve spent at least 3k in those 5 month on this maybe even 4k so i ve been getting more calorie in and my period went back to being regular 28 day on the dot for 5 month straight but my pocket are shot when i m supposed to be saving to move out so the past few of month i ve been trying to force myself to cook and eat and this is quick or easy kind of food throw it in an oven microwave etc but i don t think from home and i thought i wa doing good with it but i m still not eating enough calorie some day i eat 2 3 time a day and only manage lt 1k calorie some day i only eat once or not at all and now my period is late last month my period came early at 26 day i knew what this meant and i ve been trying to eat more but now i m 1 day late and still don t feel the sign that it s coming yet this is what my period have looked like in the past year http imgur com a mg9lkmv eating wa a lot easier before i wa vegan because all the processed and fast food wa cheap if need be while providing all the calorie then i d just take multivitamin but being vegan is proving extremely difficult for me and i m hating myself so much for it i went vegan for ethical reason so i simply cannot stomach the idea of eating animal and i m still struggling with eating enough i m not sure why i m even writing here but if anyone ha word to share i d really appreciate it

for vegan activism to be more impactful it must fundamentally change it approach i ll start this off by making this clear i m on your side i want your cause to succeed please read the rest of this post with this in mind and approach it with open mindedness and self awareness amp x200b during the past decade veganism ha become a viable mainstream alternative to the traditional western omnivore diet it is now more accepted than ever and it benefit are backed up by science however it still isn t something completely normalized especially in developing country and there s still a lot of work left to do for environmental and vegan activist now in my opinion the reason why this uphill battle is so much more difficult than it should be is that mainstream vegan activism is so overly aggressive that it turn potential ally into disassociated indifferent asset peta for better or worse is the face of the vegan brand around the world and it marketing approach is horrendously hostile actively insulting people listen to this you will never change someone s mind when you start a conversation with you are wrong stupid and a bad person here s why call it immaturity overly sensitivity whatever that fact remains true that s the same reason why climate change awareness is so difficult to get across people s mind very few people have the ability to be that introspective and take that amount of personal responsibility to sacrifice something without a tangible reward for them you are right you have the truth and the moral high ground on your side use that responsibly use it a a tool and not a a weapon instead of sharing belligerent meme to fight back the status quo or the obnoxious intolerant people that you have come across with be patient instead create a platform and a space where people can feel safe talking to you and asking question and seeking help most of u have been conditioned and indoctrinated to eat meat and dairy product stop acting like it's not hard stop acting like it isn t a hardship for some to leave something that brings them so much joy i ve lived in several country throughout my life and you have no idea how out of touch you can sound when you nag people who are trying to quit meat gradually instead of instantly in third world country vegan alternative are much more difficult to acquire and the building block for a well balanced tasty diet without the help of animal based product are simply not there sometimes people find comfort in their favorite food and to take that away from them is going to be challenging but if you want to gain more follower in your movement i implore you to leave the self righteousness behind and learn to be resilient ignorant people will give you shit so what prove that you are in this for the right reason and talk to them teach them and be patient it take time for people to come around and find within themselves the answer and strength to take this kind of life changing decision all of you together need to change your radical approach i know that animal are being tortured to an incomprehensible level but if you want to win this generational war you need to do it with kindness and understanding you may think it's dumb and that people should just grow up and do the right thing well guess what that s not gonna happen by guilting them that s why there are so many visceral attack against you people are in denial and have protective mechanism you shall strip those down one at a time you may be thinking changing people is not my responsibility and you are right this post is written for those of you who already had taken on that responsibility who have already talked to your friend and family and are active on social medium and donate and volunteer your time slow and steady win the race you are on the right side of history and if you know history you understand that these thing are won by fighting methodically not emotionally this is my feedback to you i want this world to be better for the next generation and you are a big part of that but you must change

i try to help animal but have made plenty of mistake in the process am i a bad person hi like the other member of this sub i love animal and i often cry thinking of animal being killed this feeling ha caused me to buy 5 pig in hope of giving them a life outside of the slaughterhouse my first 4 pig i had to give to animal sanctuary because i didn't have a place where the landlord wa ok with them my mum often scold me that i wa wrong and irresponsible i don't think she understands how deeply i love animal despite becoming a vegetarian after i became one aged 12 i honestly do not regret getting my first 4 pig because the fact is they would be dead right now had i not bought them right now i have my 5th pig i will admit to you i didn't have permission from my landlord to get a pig but i wa hoping my flatmate wouldn't mind however one minded the pig happened to run off at which point it wa taken to a stable pending the ear tag which i then ordered i have now collected the pig and taken it to pet boarding pending moving into a rented flat with a garden in a few day i am being totally honest here when i say i didn't look for housing until after having the pig largely because i doubted any landlord would say yes but i couldn't take it any more thinking of innocent creature dying i did spend some time with the pig for 4 day before it wa at the stable or pet boarding another thing that made me worry i'm a bad person is that i took the pig on a walk and it only walked with me half the time and it plopped down and i dragged it a bit because it wa too heavy to hold it's 3 month old but it weight almost 35 kg i then noticed part of it skin wa bleeding and i felt really bad like wow this is my fault i also find myself flying by the seat of my pant because i find most online info too confusing to understand however i have requested contact info for the farm from where the stable order pig feed so i should be able to feed it properly going forward this morning i fed it a whole easter cake i felt a bit ashamed though that i googled can pig eat dog food before taking my pig to the pet boarding i guess all this ha made me feel like i do have good intention but i sometimes think i'm some sort of idiot because of all the trouble i get into with my piglet and i wonder if something is wrong with my brain i will say my pig liked me very much it loved sitting on my lap and lying next to me it loved spooning a well and often fell asleep next to me anyways i'm open to suggestion

for european selenium for example is no problem for people who are living in place with selenium rich soil like canada or huge part of the u i also wrote down how i recommend getting these nutrient very very crucial vitamin b12 supplement very crucial vitamin d not just for vegan people who don't live in sunny area of the world should supplement it iodine also depends on your location i recommend a supplement since the iodine content in algae is hugely varying dha seed with high ala content like flax chia or hemp if you are worried about your conversion rate better supplement it together if epa crucial zinc legume pumpkin sunflower chiaseeds some nut etc epa same a dha but le crucial because ala is converted easier into epa than into dpa selenium this depends on your local soil i recommend a supplement because the selenium content of brazil nut are hugely varying le crucial iron seed dried apricot oat legume etc vitamin b2 found in small part in many food so it should add up even if you never thought about your b2 intake very good source are mushroom and almond calcium plant milk with extra calcium green many other vegetable nut mineral water etc vitamin k2 can be converted from k1 best source is kale not really crucial but worth mentioning protein legume whole grain nut seed etc lysine most crucial amino acid for vegan and one of the many reason you should eat your legume every day some seed also have huge amount energy you should consider eating more since vegan food tend to have a lower calorie density also notice that vitamin a is easy to get from conversation from beta carotene but some people i think one in 10 000 but idk the exact number can't convert beta carotene properly these people should consider eating more carots sweet potato and pumpkin or taking a retinol supplement main source niko rittenau german nutritionist specialized in veganism

a story about social deconstruct hello there fellow vegan http preview redd it 96csy5nk1fq61 jpg width 1600 amp format pjpg amp auto webp amp s 0aa778ea8ba7325774f50459cd935320f98df0a6 so what's that a pizza one that is vegan and cheese free so what so begin the story of an individual who knocked down everything he knew about how the thing are supposed to be amp x200b veganism changed my take on pizza when i made my first vegan pizza year ago i wa sooooo attached to put cheese replacement that's how it is supposed to be that's how tradition work that's how it will be oh god i had hard time to swallow those industrial vegan cheese my tummy wa not happy year later i now make pizza without cheese some people around me feel like it's not real pizza because we don't have the pleasure of that melted cheese string growing a you try to tear it the higher you raise it and i get it it wa 30 year of habit that i had to put aside i loved every single cheese string but pizza sorry dear italian can be and will from now on for me at least be enjoyed without cheese or any kind of replacement it just requires to deconstruct what society told you pizza should be a the song say make your own kind of pizza topped it with your own special part or something like this i don't know gt for those who don't have the song reference here it is http youtu be iq7dtmpwui8 http youtu be iq7dtmpwui8 i know i know dude it's just a freaking pizza i guess you are right but this pizza right here is the result of year of year of social deconstruct not just veganism oh no i wish it wa that simple it catapulted me in a world i never though to discover a world where i had to deconstruct my whole social world it's a muscle every time i watched a documentary on veganism that muscle activated doubt everything question everything is this how thing are supposed to be why male character have more dialogue time in disney than female one are electric car really that green are we supposed to be all boy girl why should asian should be good at math and rice eater when i eat more rice than 80 of the one i know should i eat this boeuf bourguignon at christmas because we've been doing it since i wa born why is it that i should have a kid by now it may be be far fetched i mean the guy is writing about lgbtqia+ about food about relation between men and woman and all those in between my bad i'm not familiar enough yet well it all boiled down to that one simple thing social deconstruct 30 year of having meat every meal 30 year of drinking milk because they are our friend french ad 30 year of considering meat manly and vegetable an option and so much more i am thankful for veganism not because i live an almost cruelty free lifestyle but because i had to deconstruct the world around me and ended up more humble about my life a a white guy in a developped country and compassionate for those who must endure for a great number of people being vegan is about the animal and the cruelty i'm not completely there yet but someday i will god i hate those ingredient list that end with 0 01 of powedered milk for now it is about deconstructing everything i know about the world i wa raised in and that dear reader is a pizza which ha been socialy deconstructed and rebuilt from scratch well almost i still make them round most of the time with tomato sauce and all but you got the idea the best i have every week for several month now one day i'll be fully vegan one deconstruction at a time not sure about the goal of this post probably some make my ego blush a tinny little bit but i also hope it could serve some people to tackle way more than veganism in their path amp x200b have a wonderful day people may the vegan god shower you with lentil and kindness

i turned meat eater to vegan because of alex o'connor cosmic skeptic on youtube and earthling ed i posted this to the cosmic skeptic youtube dude and vegan reddit about a week ago and then just found this sub being the upvote whore that i am i thought i would copy paste it in case anyone here cared p this post ended up being really long and rambling so im adding this at the start tl dr i went from meat lover to vegan almost literally overnight because of alex's argument for veganism and the documentary land of hope and glory by earthling ed wa what pushed me over the edge and finally made me abandon my cognitive dissonance and excuse i wa making i dont know if he read anything on this sub but if by any chance alex see this then thank you for all your work and opening my eye to the immense amount of suffering and death that i have been supporting all my life up until this point ive been watching for a while mainly interested in the philosophical argument after watching atheist experience for a number of year and honestly when he first started doing veganism related content i wasnt very interested and only flicked through a couple of video not really paying attention but something stuck in my mind and eventually i came back to watch a bunch of it fully and i came to the realization that there is simply no valid argument at least for someone in my position for consuming animal product in the way i did i resisted at first mainly using a pretty lazy and nihilistic justification of well im such a small cog in the machine what im doing make no real difference but i felt a pang of guilt every time i ate meat this lasted i think several month then roughly a week or so ago i sat down with a pork sausage sandwich and started browsing youtube video and i come across podcast 9 with earthling ed http youtu be r btn8ajs04 http youtu be r btn8ajs04 i watch for a little while and am hit with the same guilt ive been feeling more and more often a what i now recognize to be my cognitive dissonance start to break down partway through the video earthling ed's documentary land of hope and glory wa mentioned i had never heard of him or any of his work before watching the interview link to the documentary gt http www landofhopeandglory org http www landofhopeandglory org and i wa curious so i paused that video and googled it and started watching the pork sausage sandwich is about half eaten at this point a much a i kind of hate overly dramatic language like this i dont think it an exaggeration to say that video changed my life i had heard before about the process of slaughtering animal about how they were stunned with a boltgun and then had their throat cut or how pig were put into gas chamber but i had never actually been confronted with it never been forced to witness an actual intelligent living animal screaming in pain and terror and clawing at the cage around it a it suffocated to death or witnessing a cow fail to be stunned in a setting right out of a cheesy torture porn horror movie and have it throat slashed while still conscious and it horrific writhing a it bleeds to death and a silly a it sound i remember looking at that sausage sandwich on my desk and something finally clicked in my head and i no longer saw it a just a tasty lunch but a a lump of dead meat from a tortured animal and i simply could not finish that sandwich i even tried to reason with myself that it wa just a waste of food to throw it away at this point but i just couldn't stomach it and from there the floodgate had opened i realized that if i couldn't eat meat anymore then milk and cheese were off the table too since those industry were just a bad for all the same reason fish i found were more difficult to empathize with and i almost flirted with the idea of going vegan except still consuming fish until i mentally slapped myself with how silly that idea wa can fish really feel pain i swear i read they couldnt a quick google informed me that yes fish have nervous system and therefore feel pain duhhhhh and of course i realized that ive always found the japanese whaling industry incredibly problematic so why am i applying those standard to large sealife but not smaller one ive not been vegan long now a i said about a week but honestly what ha surprised me most is this it so easy i had this idea in my head before that i would have to be some sort of ridiculous taste martyr to be vegan and exist off of salad and nut for the rest of my life and then i had my first vegan sausage and realised if i didnt know better i would have thought it wa meat alternative cheese butter milk chicken sausage etc it all taste really good what the hell why isnt this better known a for health my diet ha been quickly improving im still consuming wayyyyy too much sugar im far too addicted to fizzy drink but im eating far more leafy green veg and fruit and im really enjoying it the only problem im having now is trying not to be the preachy vegan to my family i dont know whats right at this point to live and let live or to really try and push what ive learned on those close to me i almost feel obligated to try and spread the message at this point a penance for all the suffering ive caused this wa wayyyy longer than i meant to make it and if you made it this far thankyou for listening to my rambling

i m officially going vegan after watching seaspiracy my lifelong love of seafood and meat crumbled before my eye it s time for me to stand up and do what s right i have two younger sister that have been vegan for year and they have tried to get me to do the same but i just never wanted to do it i guess i tried to ignore how my food got to me because the reality wa a little hard to stomach so naturally a a selfish human i repressed the fact and continued to indulge in animal product this morning all of that changed watching seaspiracy on netflix literally broke my heart i love my planet i love the ocean i love the whale i love the dolphin the sea turtle the fishies but how dare i ever say that if i am contributing to the extinction of the most gentle creature in the sea a the documentary ended my stomach initially churned with disgust in myself no more seafood i said to myself but then instantly i remember one of the whale poacher saying that he saw it no different than the meat industry and he ha a damn good point i love animal i love this planet i want to do whatever it take to save it and despite my love for meat like you guy have no idea i love love love seafood and meat i m ready to put it behind me i ve tasted some delicious plant based alternative before a per the generosity of my sister so i know that i ll be able to continue enjoying the juicy flavor and texture of our fuzzy and fishy friend plant based food have come such a long way i know this is probably a very boring and jumbled post but i don t have anyone to really talk to about it right now and i feel like such a new woman already i m ready to do my part and i just hope that the whole world can begin to fee this way too i m going in for the whole nine yard no animal product not just food will ever be purchased by myself or my boyfriend ever again i can t believe it took me so long but i m glad i finally got here i m ready to do my part to save the planet

i just switched over you know i never thought of myself ever being vegan because it just didn't seem to fit for me but after evaluating my choice and my extreme fear of getting cancer i decided to switch nowadays i am eating 2 meal a day and eating 1 800 calorie a day i am doing intermittent fasting 16 8 this is usually what i eat in a day now breakfast 2 cup of cheerio 1 cup of milk smoothie banana 3 4 cup milk 2 tbsp peanut butter peanut butter and jelly sandwich 3 4 cup of milk 1 cup of carrot dinner spaghetti 3oz spaghetti 1 2 cup sauce garlic powder 1 2 cup bean 2 cup of broccoli 1 8 block of tofu 8oz grape juice 1oz peanut the hardest part wa giving up parmesan cheese because it is a good tasting food but i substituted it with garlic powder i do not expect to be doing activism though because i am an introverted person and i try to stay away from people at all cost i only go outside for 15 minute a day because i feel sick and frustrated when around other people i know this is a very lengthy post and i'm sorry for this diatribe about this stuff but thank you for reading

vegan are obnoxious moralizers because they realize ten of thousand of holocaust tier atrocity are being committed every year for decade just for fleeting taste i used to think veganism is just a fad virtue signal and while i maintain that the messaging on the issue can be better sometimes i now have every sympathy for their attitude and have decided to become a vegan myself realizing the moral implication of meat eating it is like waking up from a fever dream in cold sweat it's like those horror story where the protagonist came out of a trance induced by some lovecraftian menace and realize that everyone else is still in that trance and are being controlled to slaughter and torture for pleasure you desperately cry unto them pleading begging for everyone to wake up to recognize what's happening only to be met by zombie like reactionary out lash when you truly understand what the animal product industry is doing outrage frustration and despair are the most natural response of course in activism the tone and language must be carefully managed a to not provoke a reaction from the public but after becoming a vegan i absolutely get why people in the movement have this emotional outcry for others to change

i'm curious why did you choose to go vegan and would you eat egg if they were your own free range chicken hello obligatory i'm not a vegan but i've been enjoying more tofu and plant based meal a of late i still don't mind eating meat but i prefer not to when i have the option i did have a genuine question though if you raised your own chicken just for fun would you eat their egg i ask because i used to raise poultry not for meat purpose and they were always producing egg the hen if no rooster wa present would rarely be broody they were rarely broody even with a rooster so the egg were just left in the nest i understand going vegan out of concern for animal and their treatment but in this case no animal is being harmed and it keep animal like snake and raccoon out of your coop because they know there are no egg is there anything that make eating these egg unethical in your eye or would it be okay because you own these chicken and they're free range not being forced to live in terrible condition to maximize production i'm just genuinely curious i choose vegan option at the store when possible if i have the budget for it since it can get expensive but i spent the majority of my childhood raising chicken and just couldn't get this question out of my head i do understand not wanting to buy egg in the store because of the horrible condition they keep chicken in i would also just genuinely like to know what made you choose to go vegan question aside did you start out vegetarian first or did you hop right in i hope none of my question offend and thank you for taking the time to read this i just want to become more educated on the topic and understand it from a different perspective i chose to post this here not r debateavegan because i wasn't interested in a debate i just wanted to understand veganism more if you feel like it may belong better there then i can move it

keeping old leather textile i still have some old leather shoe jacket and belt and i don't think i want to get rid of them i feel guilty wearing them and feel some shameful obligation to hide them to prove i'm vegan now but in my logical mind i feel like no longer using those thing would be wasteful and the thought of getting rid of them somehow make me feel worse i feel like i have a responsibility to get a much use out of them a i can to prevent waste of the animal product i already have that are decade old it may be against the vegan moral philosophy to continue to utilize these thing but i'm personally significantly le concerned with something a abstract emotional and personal a moral consistency a i am with reducing actual harm and improving condition for everyone is there is a good philosophical justification for ceasing use of old leather stuff i've reflected on why i feel guilt anyway and i've decided that it's all just emotional guilt with it only basis in some code and no basis on my actual impact on the world on the result avoiding waste seems like the most positive action i can take i wanted to know what you guy think

a discussion on zoo i know i'll probably get a lot of hate for this but it's something i need to get off my chest and am genuinely interested if people are willing to have an adult conversation about this a a vegan and animal lover i also don't hate zoo i follow a lot of vegan page on instagram watch vegan youtubers and over and over i see nothing but hate for zoo saying they should all be closed and that everyone who visit one should be cancelled etc usually attached to some old photo from third world country zoo with animal living in horrible condition my belief is that in an ideal world zoo's wouldn't exist and every animal would live freely in it's natural habitat but sadly we don't live in an ideal world we live in a world filled with pollution habitat destruction hunting mass scale farming over fishing destroying the ocean and in this world zoo's sadly are vital for the care of wild animal i work in this industry and see it all from the inside so i find it upsetting when some vegan are so quick to judge and so short sighted on zoo i work in a small town wildlife sanctuary at this sanctuary yes we do have animal on display that are captive animal and can't be released to the wild and yes we charge people ticket to enter because that's the only funding we get but behind the scene we have a hospital where we rescue rehab and release wild animal hundred per year who never see the public and have limited contact with human and what do we do when we get a case we can't handle we take it to the zoo we are a small establishment with limited facility but we have a good relationship with the local zoo which ha an amazing big animal hospital we get everything from pelican with fishing wire down their throat to wombat who have been hit by a car but one thing is consistent to almost all of our rescue and that is that they are needing to be rescued because of interference from human in one way or another we caused the problem so we feel the need to help fix it also my sanctuary is almost entirely volunteer run we work long hour mostly outdoors in all sort of weather for zero pay just because we are passionate about helping animal i also recently visited another much larger wildlife sanctuary in a different state which had about 200 300 animal on display but in 2020 alone they rescued rehabed then released 14 000 wild animal just in one year and the truth about this is that no one else can really do this but zoo people take injured native wildlife to vet but vet rarely know how to treat animal outside of cat and dog and they usually just sit in a cage until they can be transferred to a zoo or specialised wildlife carer between breeding program of endangered animal to all the rescue work with zoo hospital to the extensive conservation work done worldwide to help ensure the future of wildlife etc zoo are now vital to our world if you like animal i see this all from inside the industry so it's kind of frustrating to see vegan pointing to thing like tiger king or third world zoos' or other horrible abusive attraction and using those to say all zoo are evil and should be closed if all zoo's closed overnight it would be devastating for the world's wild animal it's the sad truth zoo's aren't all made equal worldwide yes there are some horrific sad abusive zoo's and wildlife attraction that i wish would close a much a anyone but that shouldn't diminish the good amazing zoo and the people who work at them tldr i wish vegan would actually research what go on at zoo before judging them all so harshly or judging them all by the worst example of zoo on the planet

did anyone else have vegan realization a a kid i remember when i wa 5 or 6 year old my parent took me on a boat trip during a holiday after we got off the boat and took a stroll around the dock i saw some men scaling fish with the back of a knife it wa a violent scraping and scale were flying in the air but the fish were still alive during the process they were wildly flopping around on the workbench a the men tried to hold them down a a little kid seeing this i wa utterly distraught and it literally traumatized me to some degree the memory and the sheer callousness of it is still etched into my mind a few year later when i wa around 8 my mom had gone grocery shopping and prepared a dinner for the family when she called me to the table there wa a rack of lamb sitting on a platter seeing the little ribcage on our table like that is when the connection between the animal and my food suddenly became really salient it wasn't food it wa part of a corpse i remember being horrified protesting to my parent about it storming to my room cry i knew how precious lamb were and would have done anything to protect them since then i had an aversion to any type of meat with visible bone in it sidenote my grandpa had a flock of sheep and in the springtime i'd get to go and play with the lamb year later i would find out that he'd always choose the juiciest one to be butchered and then we'd eat it flesh during christmas dinner and other holiday none of my family bothered to tell me where the meat came from there are countless more example a a kid i saw animal frantically pacing back and forth in tiny zoo enclosure watched lobster get chucked into boiling pot of water etc i've always found it absolutely horrendous yet i still didn't go vegan until i wa 17 perhaps most child are vegan at heart but succumb to the pressure of conforming to social norm a they grow older especially being told the happy cow spiel and all that do any of you have similar story

when wa the first seed planted into your mind and how long did it take for you to go vegan first of all i wanna apologize for my bad english i'm not a native speaker but i want to share my story and hear about yours when i wa young i thought vegan were crazy and i remember joking around with my brother about those protein deficient and opinion forcing plant eater i knew about the fact of the inhumane circumstance of lifestock farming and the outrageous consequence for our enviroment but never reflected on them this all changed when i wa 13 in early 2016 i wa eating my favourite dish spaghetti bolognese when i scrolled through the trending youtube video and a video called fleischkonsum zerst√∂rt unseren planeten meat consumption destroys our planet by the german vegan influencer luna darko came into my sight she would influence me pretty much in the following year on what person i want to be in the future she seemed pretty smart and empathic and often talked about self love self discovery feminism etc sadly she deleted this video and distanced herself from the label 'vegan' last year at this time i wa very open and interested in enviromental topic so i clicked on this video i remember listening to what she had to say she sounded very calm polite and friendly but you could also tell that this wa a very important topic to her she talked mostly about the eniviroment but also about the connection to starvation deseases and health issue and ethic i remember when she said i know this might be the least convincing point for most people which i think is very sad cause we should care about this but a pig ha the same cognitive capability a a 3 year old human but for me it wa one of the most convincing point beside those about the complex social structure and emotion of cow and chicken in the following day i gave frequent thought on this matter and decided that i want to be vegan myself someday but not now my father cooked much meat at this time and i don't wanted the social stigma of a male vegan for some reason i didn't even made a first step in the following year but i knew that becoming vegan wa the only right thing to do i informed myself further on this topic and often argued in favor of veganism but when a dairy or meat product wa on my plate i forgot about it i devoloped a hobby in cooking in 2017 and became the chef of what i eat i reduced my flesh consumption but still ate much of it this changed in march 2020 when my school stopped because of a global zoonotic pandemic and i decided to make the first step and got veggie i knew that this wasn't enough and that i still wanted to be vegan someday but i loved cheese which of course i knew isn't a proper reason to eat it but nevertheless i still ate it my father with whom i live with wa very supportive beside often making stupid joke and statement i became very interested in health topic and started practising and eating more vegetable fruit legume and whole grain i read many book and article and nearly became obsessed with nutrition so i discovered niko rittenau german vegan nutritionist and dr michael greger and read their book vegan klischee ade maybe the best book on nutrition critical nutrient and debunking nutrition based stereotype about veganism sadly it's only available in german and how not to die which had many shocking fact in it so i decided to finally go vegan on my 1st anniversary of becoming vegetarian it's been one week and it's a miracle there were 2 3 day in which i craved for cheese but now i don't even miss it anymore despite our fridge being full of it i am very happy that i'm finally vegan and regret that i haven't done it sooner but now i'm excited to hear about how your first seed wa planted

any musician in here have you noticed any change while on a vegan diet i have this post is a bit odd for this subreddit but i think it s sufficiently on topic first my brief background is that i ve been a musician for about 20 year and i ve been mostly vegan for about 2 month lifestyle change take work and time so please forgive me for the mostly qualifier i m sure you all understand anyhow i immediately within a day or two started noticing measurable and subjective improvement in my health my resting heart rate ha lowered from 72 to 56 on average holy smoke my wedding ring is also looser and that brings me to the subjective part it s fairly well known that a plant based diet lower inflammation throughout the entire body a compared to a for lack of a better term typical american diet but what i didn t expect wa that this would directly transfer to my ability to play my instrument i m a percussionist which is basically a pompous high brow term for drummer badum tschhh when it come to almost any instrument a lot boil down to your technique which determines your energy output and physical stress on soft tissue and joint well in my case my muscle have been able to fly through music and exercise a if i were 10 year younger which wa actually my peak physical condition i get le tired i m le sore and i recover much faster my muscle aren t are swollen after intense playing and i m ready to go in le than half the recovery time it s insane i wanted to share this because it ha boosted my mood beyond anything i ever expected i m finally jazzed about drumming again after a 2 year hiatus due to various reason i didn t think an unrelated lifestyle change would make such a huge impact but it really did also related my wife is also a musician flutist and she ha reported a similar experience i ve been skeptical my whole life about vegan plant based diet lifestyle i really wish i tried this sooner i just feel so much better overall a boost toward getting back into my passion is seriously heart warming too

i found an interesting article on the history of veganism i got a lot of blowback from this community because of a recent post where i simply shared an opinion community member insulted my intelligence and told me to get educated so i did thank time magazine for their article a brief history of veganism the first vegetarian society wa formed in 1847 in england three year later rev sylvester graham the inventor of graham cracker co founded the american vegetarian society graham wa a presbyterian minister and his follower called grahamites obeyed his instruction for a virtuous life vegetarianism temperance abstinence and frequent bathing in november 1944 a british woodworker named donald watson announced that because vegetarian ate dairy and egg he wa going to create a new term called vegan to describe people who did not tuberculosis had been found in 40 of britain s dairy cow the year before and watson used this to his advantage claiming that it proved the vegan lifestyle protected people from tainted food three month after coining the term he issued a formal explanation of the way the word should be pronounced veegan not veejan he wrote in his new vegan society http www vegansociety com home php newsletter which had 25 subscriber by the time watson died at age 95 in 2005 there were 250 000 self identifying vegan in britain and 2 million in the u s

a question hello so i've been transitioning to a more plant based lifestyle i used to identify myself a vegan but i felt it wa inappropriate and did not want to spread misinformation about the movement this is due to me disagreeing with a fundamental core to veganism namely the reduction of animal suffering by any practical mean i do not view animal exploitation a inherently evil i believe it must depend on the circumstance almost all form of animal agriculture today are cruel and i accept that leading me to adjust my lifestyle to avoid a much contribution to the industry a i can however my disagreement lie in the fact that science is leading to more and more way where we can use animal product in sustainabe economical and le cruel way i will use the popular example of lab grown meat we are moving past the need for fbs and the method are getting more and more productive i read in an article the projection is we can create 20 000 pound of beef from a cell collection the implication of this are monumental we could get to the point where we only need a small donor herd per region the small size of this population will imensly reduce greenhouse gas and will be easier to maintain these animal and provide them with an optimum quality of life the only downside is being a relatively painless biopsy amp x200b i suppose the crux of what i'm saying is that i think the exploitation of animal product can be done in an ethical way if certain parameter are met amp x200b this lead me to my question is this dissertation at odds with veganism i greatly welcome criticism comment or question

my journey being vegan and my thought about it hey guy i want to share how my lifestyle changed going vegan and how it gave me a new perspective about what we're eating and the overall picture with the current food chain i also want to know what you're going to think about my perspective since i have in some way different view for which i will get maybe downvoted but just hear me out when i started college i started living on my own which meant that i had to cook for myself which i never did before moving out i wanted to start experimenting a little with what i eat and my friend told me he wa a netflix documentary the game changer which i decided to give a try and try to avoid animal and dairy product on my plate it started slowly but i stopped buying meat then slowly getting rid of egg cheese switched to plant based milk with this change my teenage acne is 98 gone which wa bad when i wa in high school energy level really boosted i don't feel heavy when i finish my meal even if i fill myself completely discovered so many way of cooking and recipe after seeing this change i wa reading more about how animal agriculture work and it wa such an eye opener how messed up the whole industry work and how i wa uneducated about where doe the food come from what doe it contain how much nutrition it ha what's good and what's not how many animal are killed coming from an eastern europe where meat is basically on a plate every second day it wa quite a change my family is still in confusion why the 'drastic' change but i won't be coming back to the eating habit because with the information i gained living in ignorance or unawareness about how my action impact animal the planet wa on one hand blissful because let's face it everybody love cheese meat but it's not right at the expense of others not in this era when we have so many substitute and option to choose from and with the climate crisis but here's my second thought about it if the animal industry and dairy industry operated in a more sustainable moral way i would support it i grow up in a village my grandma had her own chicken whose egg were incomparable with the one available in supermarket we also got a homemade cheese from one of her friend who got their own cow my belief is that if dairy animal product were consumed once a month or just on special occasion and didn't take it for granted we could reduce the suffering global warming in a great way right now in college i am fully vegan i read carefully what's on the label of the product i buy making sure no animal ingredient are in them however when i come home for a few week i have to cheat because i am not the one cooking and my family always put some milk dairy into the food but i won't touch any meat they prepare i can see that i made some positive impact on my family and friend a well they started eating oat in the morning tofu soya chunk but they are not willing to transform their eating habit completely if you read this all the way through let me know your thought please

shameless plug for vegan meal kit service + idea for trying new recipe i just wanted to put this out there for anyone who might be struggling to find new vegan recipe or healthier recipe or whatever meal kit are a great option basically the idea behind meal kit is you get the ingredient for a certain number of meal on average three per week sent to you with a recipe card and you make them they're marketed towards people who don't have much time to grocery shop and cook or who eat a lot of fast food i personally keep the recipe card in a binder so that i can make the one i liked again there are company that offer vegan option and also one company purple carrot that is entirely vegan the only downside is price tag 7 10 per portion is quite a bit so it's definitely a luxury for me and i don't order every week ha anyone else tried these or have similar way to try out new vegan dish that don't involve a separate trip to the grocery store and ton of leftover ingredient i would love to do it more but it's time consuming and spending 10 for a particular spice that i'm never going to use for anything else again is a bit steep

i've been vegan for one month now and thing are going well the biggest struggle is figuring out how to vary my meal i eat oatmeal and a banana every morning spinach and black bean wrap for lunch and either tofu rice brocoli or quinoa brocoli for dinner sometimes pasta i tried tempeh and wasn't a huge fan but i really need to figure out some more meal to fit in any suggestion i'm open to try new thing another concern of mine is the consumption of soy i'm male and although the estrogen thing seems to be nonsense i have heard that high level of soy could lead to infertility and since i'd like to have kid someday i dont want to overdo it until i can do more research but dang i'd eat tofu everyday otherwise i haven't told anyone really yet my mom know and my brother know now but i just don't like attention and i'm scared of people making comment to me and i just don't want to deal with it quite yet shoe were a unexpected curveball i really needed new shoe and my mom surprised me by getting me some which wa nice of her but i had to be sure they were vegan information wa hard to find but i ended up calling sketcher customer service and gave them the item number they confirmed that the shoe are vegan yay i need skate shoe a well so hopefully i can find some vegan skate brand soon i watched dominion after becoming vegan and it just solidified my choice i couldn't watch more than 10 minute of it without cry horribly i can't imagine anyone can watch this and think yeah this is ok i'll just keep getting animal product but i know some do i still haven't finished it but i can only take it bit by bit the thought of eating animal product just make me sick at this point i'll keep going no turning back

the sneaky vegan hear me out my best friend is the best vegan i have ever met she is a vegan because that is what she morally belief is right but she ha never once tried to make me eat vegan even when i'm with her i've had friend before that were vegan and whenever we're together they expect me to eat vegan and i do not give them a hard time about that because i understand that is their moral stance when we're making pancake together she make hers vegan and she's like oh i almost forgot you're not vegan and you prefer it with egg and she make mine with egg so i'm not kidding the most respectful vegan i have ever met we have been friend for 5 year that being said she ha shown me some really yummy vegan food company that have microwave meal that are delicious that i just actually like and when i'm with her sometimes i choose to eat vegan with her and she's shown me some really good recipe she's also british so her family ha forced me to love tea and we were talking about tea and she's like well i make it this way with almond milk but of course you'll probably be using regular milk so just use this much to make it just the way you like it at my house and i wa like oh my gosh you know what i think the tea would probably taste really good with almond milk instead of my dairy milk i should definitely use almond milk because it's also really good in and i listed a few other recipe that i use it in although i don't like drinking almond milk or using it in cereal then suddenly i realized and i called her on it i'm like you are sneakily making me vegan you are playing the long game and i respect that you respect the fact that i'm not vegan so much that i feel the need to respect the fact that you're vegan more than i normally would and you're showing me how yummy it can be how dare you i'm going to go drink my vegan tea with my vegan pancake

thought on investing in lab grown meat stock a a vegan it seems one of the best way that i thought of so far to actually make a change by investing in thing that will make non vegan not hurt animal open to other suggestion if you have better for what to invest money in which are in line with vegan ethical value but this is the best i came up with so far granted i only began thinking on the subject recently so don't know all that's out there i first got interested when i heard bill gate say he invests in impossible burger that isn't lab grown meat afaik but it made me think of the idea of investing in ethical share i had been researching general investment lately and looking for good cause and thinking this could be a great one also putting you money to work i feel is better than just dumping it in a charity because with share you can increase the return and then put it back into other company and repeat etc although i still probably wouldn't personally think it ideal still preferring totally plant based diet from a pragmatic standpoint i also know that for the majority of the population this is of no interest to them so investing in lab grown meat is helping to stop the killing of real animal i think it is hopeless in my lifetime at least to expect the majority of the population to go plant based so might a well focus your effort in the lesser evil and if it is just like real meat then it will more be a case of getting the big food chain to start using it a the customer would fall in line sooner or later with some good marketing the food supplier would do it probably only if it is cheaper for them and that is a long way off a this technology is way more expensive than normal meat but it is something to work towards eh for a better future like how elon's car are expensive but it is the long term vision to bring the price down thought

disillusioned with speciesist leftist random musing honestly i feel like for many leftist being anti oppression is more about identity and performance than anything else basically it feel good to project an image of being a radical and to receive validation from others it reassures our moral self understanding it help our social life it let u connect with others in our tribe it doesn't take much effort for a white person to share a blm article or even attend a rally it doesn't make much effort for a man to talk about women's right there's cultural support for these stance it doesn't take real conviction to get on board one the other hand here we have this gargantuan atrocity billion of sentient being systematically tortured and killed they are being gassed and castrated and electrocuted all so we can literally eat their body for pleasure three day old infant literally have their nut sliced out screaming and their dead body are sold anyone who think about it honestly for even 5 minute know it's pure evil it's not even kind of bad it's at the level of the worst crime in history but most non vegan leftist don't care enough to go vegan or even to do the bare as minimum of raising awareness why because there isn't much of a personal pay off in being anti speciesist you have to change your behavior concretely not just say the right thing you have to accept that you've been doing something wrong your whole life and you have to go against the majority there are real tangible change required of being a proponent of animal liberation which you don't find with other cause there's no bullshitting possible you have to walk the walk the fact that most leftist willfully ignore something so patently horrendous ha made me more and more cynical i don't think most people truly reason out why they believe what they do if people had a deeper understanding of why racism or sexism are wrong philosophically they'd be much more receptive to argument against speciesism but most of the time i believe many people just instinctively conform to the norm they don't reason themselves into core belief but just absorb them from others heidegger ha this concept of da man the they which basically refers to an impersonal social reality or background of thought he say that we tend to live inauthentically and just live passively accept the value of the they because that is what one doe i don't think i'm somehow about living inauthentically no one is and i don't blame non vegan who honestly are ignorant we were all their once but pretty much everyone at this point know that animal are tortured and killed for food it's willful ignorance more anything else people choose to look away simply because they get some minor benefit and because they aren't made to feel like a bad person by society

retort to vegan diet are bland boring i wanted some opinion on something i wa thinking about a hear a lot that vegan diet are boring bland etc it's often difficult to respond to this a people making these claim likely have very little knowledge of food in general one question to ask these people could be you can have the best chef in the world prepare you one dish the dish may include either only ingredient suitable for a vegan or only ingredient a vegan would not eat meat milk egg honey etc what meal do you choose i find it difficult to believe anyone would pick the later option especially considering salt is a vegan ingredient the idea here is that meat dish are heavily dependent on plant to derive nice flavour and i thought this question is an interesting way to get people thinking about that do you guy think this is thought provoking and shed an interesting insight into vegan suitable meal or have i not thought this through

interview amp usability study customer supported agriculture customer portal hello there we are graduate student in the m s human computer interaction program at georgia tech working on our capstone project we've researched and designed an internal portal to improve the relationship between csa farmer and their customer more specifically helping farmer share information about csa box and farm update with their customer currently we're trying to get feedback and insight from csa customer about the portal through a 30 minute usability study if you're a csa customer we'd love to hear your thought on the portal and how it would fit with your csa farm during the study you'll be completing a list of task on the portal and describing how you feel about the portal we'll be giving you a 10 amazon gift card for your participation here's the link to sign up http calendly com guruduttperi csa study month 2021 03

donated blood a a vegan of almost 4 year and my hemoglobin level wa good the blood bank worker said the low level is 13 and the high is 20 and my number wa 15 about a week before donating i had been eating a serving or two of quaker oat cereal which ha 80 90 of the iron rda added a a supplement along with a few mandarin orange before and after to boost vitamin c level which help iron uptake but before that cereal i had essentially done nothing special concerning iron since i became vegan in june 2017 the fact that iron absorption is coupled so closely with your blood vitamin c level is i think a key indicator of just how fundamentally important it is to be eating a wide range of plant food there is no vitamin c in traditional american meat product the inuit use raw seal brain for vitamin c sometimes so there's that anyways i just wanted to share my blood donation story because i wa pretty happy when he said my iron level wa good and then i dropped the vegan bomb on him and he wa like w what do you eat no meat no dairy a if he couldn't believe i could have that good an iron level haha
