ethic of adopting a mouse bred for snake food i posed this question in r debateavegan but it is a time sensitive issue currently awaiting moderator approval warning this post contains description of animal death tldr someone's pet snake died before he could feed the snake a mouse now he doesn't know what to do with the mouse if it becomes inevitable that he get another snake would it be preferable to rescue the little fella or to allow him to become the new snake's meal in place of a poor future mouse whose sale would benefit a scumbag rodent breeder full post i will first mention that i am a vegan of seven year and personally averse to rescuing obligate carnivore a long a human are unable to supplant their diet with adequate alternative to animal meat on a consistent basis until lab cultured option are available relying on roadkill or meat from animal culled by legal mandate leaf too much suffering to chance and i would like to provide a little consumer demand a possible to industry that exploit animal i have an uncomfortable scenario at hand until recently someone i know would feed mouse to a snake he kept a a pet he kept one mouse at a time between feeding before the most recently purchased mouse could be delivered a a meal the snake passed away the former snake owner life about 1000 mile away from me and doe not want the mouse he accepted my instinctive offer to find someone to adopt him unfortunately he plan to adopt another snake to whom he will almost certainly feed mouse on one hand i could save this mouse and feel good about having kept one innocent animal from being killed on the other hand i would probably only be swapping the life of this mouse for that of another one the human would buy from a rodent breeder which would profit the mouse seller and create demand for his business should i save one mouse now at the expense of another later or do i let him become food for the next snake in order to both save a future mouse from such a fate and avoid creating an incentive for this person to support the breeder in the future please pardon the jumble this is keeping me up and my heart and my brain are at odds i would appreciate some opinion on this one

feeling down and frustrated need to vent so the other day my husband and i were driving home after he got his second dose of the vaccine we currently live on the big island of hawaii and had just spent a wonderful day exploring since the place that did his shot wa almost 2 hour away on the other side of the island we tried a trendy vegetarian restaurant that put honey mustard on the salad that we were going to share even though we specifically requested that it be made vegan and they assured u that that wouldn't be a problem i didn't want to contribute more to the food waste problem though so my husband who is not vegan decided that he would eat the salad i decided not to let that get me down though and just enjoyed the rest of the food we ordered which wa all very good later we drove around a bit looking at some of the local shop and sight including a gorgeous waterfall and then we headed home by the time we got back to our side of the island my husband wa feeling hungry again so he suggested that we pick up some food at panda express which is not certified vegan due to cross contamination i know but doe have the eggplant tofu and chow mein which are made with plant based recipe so i'm personally okay with eating there a we approach the restaurant though my husband who normally pay get a call from his mom and asks me to go get the food so he can take the call without thinking i say sure what do you want and i'm immediately overcome with dread because i realize that he's going to ask me to get him the teriyaki chicken and walnut shrimp and then i start having a panic attack my husband who picked up the call before he realized i wa freaking out told his mom that he would call her back later and ended the call quickly he then asked if i wa okay and if we still wanted to get food i told him that i wasn't really hungry and we drove home we ended up skipping dinner altogether and we haven't really talked about what happened i think the reason i started freaking out is because i had always had a degree of separation between his eating habit and my responsibility for them but when he asked me to pick up and thus pay for his food it wa like i would be accepting personal responsibility for it and while i don't believe that his choice are wholly my responsibility i'm concerned that i haven't done enough to try to convince him to change and i feel like i've been selfishly avoiding that conversation with him because it will be awkward and uncomfortable anyway i'm just feeling really down about it and i could use some advice or encouraging story from those of you who may have had similar issue with your spouse or other loved one

when my animal die i want to leave their body in the plateau to be eaten by the wolf i want to create a farmed animal sanctuary in my ancestral homeland which is an isolated mountainous region with a wild plateau inhabited by wolf i wa wondering what to do with the animal body after they died when it dawned on me we will all hold a funeral ritual for them and take their deceased body into the wild plateau where it will be eaten by the wolf this way i will be honoring the dead animal the wolf and nature all at once imagine despite our vet s effort bolota s body wa too old and too damaged by selective breeding and he ended up dying so we all got together held a funeral and took his body in a procession into the wild plateau where we left it to be eaten by the wolf i like this idea so much that now i kinda wish that wa the custom for human too because now i would like my funeral to be like that returning to nature to the circle of life the iberian wolf are an endangered specie who wa saved from extinction in my country and now roam the pleateau of my ancestral land

alienated from my family warning long post rant i ve been vegan for almost 3 year my family mom sister and brother in law were supportive at first but basically in the sense that they thought i had found a new hobby a time ha gone on i have tried to talk to them about the reality of animal agriculture and the immense suffering they all call themselves animal lover btw i ve shared article and video etc and now it s to the point where they ignore me i don t feel like i have bombarded them with information i will share something once a month or so but about 6 week ago i shared an article about pig farming via group text and my sister hasn t contacted me since even though i ve reached out to her several time since then about completely unrelated benign topic last week mom agreed to watch dominion with me before we started it she went on and on for about 15 minute about a stray cat she had taken to an animal shelter recently and about how she wa appalled that the shelter released the cat back into the neighborhood several day later in 20 degree weather to fend for himself because they said the cat most likely belonged to someone in the neighborhood and in their experience this wa the best way for the cat to make his way back home this horrified me too that an animal shelter would deal with an animal this way but that s not my point my point is that after this discussion about the cat and how disgusted she wa with their handling of the cat my mom and i proceeded to watch dominion she didn t bat an eye she wasn t bothered or disturbed at all by the sheer terror and fear that wa evident in the animal eye and face and the horrible suffering that way shown she actually started to doze off in the middle of it but i woke her up i ll bet if i were to ask her right now what she learned about the dairy industry from that film she wouldn t be able to tell me anything she told me before we watched it that it wasn t going to change her mind i asked her to just please watch and listen with an open mind and be willing to learn something i think she just tuned it out and didn t listen to any of the narrative and assumed that the footage she wa seeing wa from isolated case not the norm i love my family but i m having an extremely hard time dealing with the hypocrisy and the blatant unwillingness to learn how their food end up on their plate it s definitely causing a rift but i don t know how to be ok with it i tell them what i have learned and they just don t care if it were about any other topic or injustice they would be receptive they just literally refuse to discus this with me or learn anything i can t stand it it s like if you know me and love me and are close to me then be open to what i m trying to share with you and show you about what i ve learned about the horror of animal agriculture i feel like they would rather cling to their right to eat animal product than to take me seriously this doesn t make me want to stay in contact with them we were so close before why won t they trust that maybe what i m trying to share with them is real if i ve learned something that upset me extremely why won t they take me seriously and consider that there might be something to what i m saying i feel like they d literally rather keep their head buried in the sand and eat animal product than have a relationship with me

vegan for the animal growing up in a first generation middle eastern family meat and dairy product were a huge part of our upbringing about four year ago one of our family member wa diagnosed with an illness instead of resorting to incorporating the prescribed medication for a lifetime we decided to go vegan a a family to help support the transition to heal with food a opposed to medication within the first few month contrary to the medical advice received at the time all sign of the illness disappeared and our family fully adopted the vegan lifestyle for health purpose ever since a the year went by many other aspect of our life changed naturally we began to become more aware of the product we were using and their impact on our body a well a the environment but one of the biggest impact adopting a vegan lifestyle ha had for me personally wa the dissolution of the concept that we a a specie are superior to others driving home on the highway the other afternoon a duck wa sitting on the asphalt road just about a foot away from the median a car drove by the driver would move over and continue their journey the highway wa two lane one way with a 50 mph speed limit there wa a man made river with a pond about a quarter mile away where the duck spend their time i pulled over to see if i could help take her to safety i approached the duck and put my hand out to let her know i wa there to help one of her foot sticking out but i couldn t see any other sign of injury she let me pick her up without any fear i carried her to the pond and placed her beside the water to let her decide whether she wanted to swim or rest i sat down next to her and spent about 20 minute by her side until her eye started to relax and her head slowly doze off a i began to realize what wa happening i sang her a song about the graceful life she must have lived at the pond i sang until she passed and immediately broke down in tear i found so much relief in knowing this small act of compassion allowed her to spend the remainder of her time at home beside the lake under the shade and in the company of her family a opposed to a hot asphalt road with massive machine roaring by her every moment until her last moment being vegan ha had many positive impact on my life but more than anything i am grateful for having been gifted the clarity to understand the vast amount of similarity we share with all other form of life to embrace the connection to our planet it landscape and all of it inhabitant we are all one and the same and i will forever be vegan for the animal

lost 110 pound in le than a year progress http imgur com gallery 5yoeicr last year around march i've lost a job at the same time covid shut down everything in my area i spent a month in my bed browsing meme on the internet until i met someone who successfully lost around 100 pound with keto i wa tired of being in my bed in a situation i couldn't control and knew covid would be the perfect opportunity to train hard eat better and fix myself i've suffered from huge back pain for year and lost a lot of money on chiropractor when the only issue wa my weight and lack of exercise i couldn't tie my shoe it wa too painful to bend over but now i can rest the palm of my hand on the floor in that position time ha come i hopped into the keto bandwagon and did intermittent fasting everyday my diet wa mostly made of fish charcuterie cheese almond milk isolate shake and lot of low carb veggie my appetite decreased over time like pure magic i cut down in half every portion of the amount of food i've used to eat and limited myself to three meal a day sometimes two no snacking i also took potassium and magnesium supplement just in case to introduce myself to consistant exercise i promised myself to do 30 min a day of cardiovascular training nothing else eliptical wa my training of choice then later i discovered a passion for jogging i recently ran a half marathon in 2 hour i couldn't believe it i still pinch myself to know if i'm dreaming or not i did that only that from april 2020 to january 2021 10 month went from 250lbs to 140lbs no excess only 30 min a day of jogging and a stable keto diet with a cheat meal on friday for me i must say i'm proud happy and i can't believe it if i had to do it again i would certainly retake the challenge without hesitating sadly i saw a lot of people around me gaining a lot of weight during the quarantine and i truly hope my story will spark a little light of motivation in them

green tea green tea http site google com view best tea to lose weight accueil green tea is one of the most well known type of tea and is linked with many health benefit it s also one of the most effective tea for weight loss there is substantial evidence linking green tea to decrease in both weight and body fat in one 2008 study 60 obese people followed a standardized diet for 12 week while regularly drinking either green tea or a placebo over the course of the study those who drank green tea lost 7 3 pound 3 3 kg more weight than the placebo group another study found that people who consumed green tea extract for 12 week experienced significant decrease in body weight body fat and waist circumference compared to a control group

why round 3 is different i ll start this off with my first two weight loss journey to give you an idea of where i have been and where i am at now i hope it give someone out there the motivation they need to find the lifestyle that work best for them keto or not my first weight loss journey in 2013 wa based on calorie restriction and cardio i paid no mind to macro since i didn t know what a macro wa i just focused on eating healthy food and made sure i had a big calorie deficit while hitting the gym for 45 minute a day i lost 30 pound in 3 month i wa stuck at 166 pound for about a week before i became so discouraged i gave up i hit a plateau and didn t know how to break it instead of being patient and trying to work through it i went back to my old bad habit my second weight loss journey wa in 2018 i had hit 209 pound on the scale my heaviest ever outside of being 230 pound when i wa 9 month pregnant with my son nope i started a low fat diet that working 2 fairly active full time job and going to the gym helped me shed 47 pound in 4 month my progress went downhill when i switched to 3rd shift at one of my job i wa stuck at 162 pound and didn t have the patience to break through the plateau i didn t give up on myself immediately this time but i lost it over time and ended up gaining all but 5 pound back within the next few year here we are round 3 sitting at 204 pound and struggling to stay awake past 6 30pm every day i knew change had to be made i joined and followed social medium group for the top trending lifestyle keto i read through so many progress post and most people have done so well with it i decided to look into this way of life a little more and read about carb restriction the one thing i haven t yet targeted i then stumbled upon an article about carb sensitivity and the warning sign i will be damned i relate to every single sign that day i discovered that i really need to limit my carbs and i decided that keto is probably best for me personally i started this journey 2 and a half month ago in february and i m already down almost 40 pound this time with minimal exercise and working only one job with this new diet paired with intermittent fasting there is no doubt in my mind that i will finally make it through the 160 s and maybe even reach my ultimate goal of 145 pound a goal that i have repeatedly failed to achieve for 7 year now with the knowledge and experience i have this time around i will succeed only 20 more pound to go the last 20 the hardest 20

how do i know when to stop supplementing my electrolyte hello i have always been low carb but am about a month in for a strict keto diet my primary motivation for doing so is to boost my focus in addition to all the other health benefit long story short i quit caffeine and nicotine about a year and a half ago but my focus dropped off a cliff to make up for it i thought i'd try a real keto diet not just low carb and i take some nootropics like lion's mane and l theanine i manage to stay well below 20 net carbs per day and i intermittently fast using the 16 8 method i can happily say that the combination of keto + nootropics ha brought my focus back to the point where i can code i'm a web developer long hour into the night like i used to before i quit all form of caffeine the downside to all this however is that since the first few day on keto i have developed a persistent non stop muscle twitch it is mostly in both my leg thigh knee and calf my foot and occasionally my arm and eyelid none of it is localized it appears to be random and i can always feel it at rest so hundred of time a day all sign and everything i could read up on pointed towards an electrolyte imbalance had a brief few day where i wa certain it wa m or al lol i decided to experiment and started taking a liquis magnesium supplement the twitch subsided big time although not disappear completely to test my hypothesis further after a few week of taking the magnesium supplement i stopped just to see what would happen what happened wa my muscle twitch ramped back up from 10 to 100 and got a bad a they were when i first started keto having said all that and noticing the correlation between the twitch and taking the magnesium supplement and not taking it my question for you fine educated folk is at what point do i stop taking the magnesium i can almost say for a certainty that the difference in twitch is huge between when i'm taking it and not is there any other electrolyte supplement i should be looking out for to help with the twitch a well if these supplement are indeed helping with the twitch and they come back when i'm not taking the supplement is there a point in keto where the electrolyte will balance itself out and the twitching will stop thanks in advance

anyone with diverticulitis and keto carnivore experience i've been doing keto ketovore for two year it ha been amazing i've lost 120 lb my back knee and hip pain have almost all gone away i have all day long energy and don't get the afternoon doldrums anymore i'm off my blood pressure med and i'm no longer pre diabetic my bloodwork ha been awesome however i've found that i have diverticulosis and recently i had an attack of diverticulitis basically an infection and massive bloating swelling etc i believe that it wa due to eating some miracle noodle basically straight up indigestible fiber and more veggie than i usually have for our family's special valentine's day weekend i wa put on antibiotic and a scan confirmed diverticulitis it wa a few horrible day of feeling like there wa a football in my gut but it seemed to heal up rather quickly by fasting just beef or chicken broth for about 3 day then slowly adding in some basic food like egg and ground beef with salt only feeling pretty normal again 7 week later i ate some dolmades sausage stuffed grape leaf and cauliflower falafel on easter they were all home made and keto even the sausage the falafel wa made with cauliflower rice but once again i had more very high fiber veggie than i usually do and started building up to an attack 9 day later it wasn't quite a bad a the first time because i had a better understanding of what wa going on and went to the dr for antibiotic ealier but it sure isn't what i would call fun i am back on fasting for the last 3 day i've only had about 4 cup of broth each day along with water and i'm supplementing with electrolyte and salt i'll start on a few egg per day over the next week and slowly work my way back ha anyone had success with fighting off diverticulitis with keto or carnivore what wa your experience i feel i can track it down to day that i had high fiber stuff and probably over ate a little bit on holiday occasion but i'm interested to know if others have had other experience i'll be having my first colonoscopy over the summer after everything heals up and i want to get my inside a clean and healed a possible over the next few month

nsv liver function test i've had high liver enzyme for year i actually didn't realize how long it's been until i registered a patient account with labcorp and got access to result dating back to 2013 i just got my newest liver test back and my biomarkers are in the normal range for the first time in 8 year here's a brief timeline of my liver metabolic issue may 2013 ast normal 0 40 39 normal alt normal 0 44 98 first time high range i'm going to fast forward to 2020 but i had over 10 more hepatic function test between the first one and 2020 and i had at least one enzyme come back high each time january 2020 liver biopsy and diagnosed with non alcoholic fatty liver disease nafld october 15 2020 ast normal 0 40 185 high alt normal 0 44 328 high mid october 2020 late january 2021 ate like shit lot of fast food and door dash pizza delivery january 31 2021 day 1 of keto started keto + 16 8 if february 17 2021 2 5 week into keto ast normal 0 40 39 normal alt normal 0 44 81 high hemoglobin a1c 7 1 first time in diabetic range april 8 2021 10 week into keto hemoglobin a1c 5 5 normal april 15 2021 11 week into keto ast normal 0 40 25 normal alt normal 0 44 36 normal

can't drink caffeine because it trigger a lot of these feeling i am 36 year old 6'1 270 lb i work a blue collar job and i struggle with it now i used to powerlift so i have a bunch of muscle on my frame i'm currently on atorvastin for cholesterol and have been for a long time testosterone cypionate every two week for hypogonadism and i take beta blocker 10mg when i have to because i get anxious driving now because i'm afraid to get spacey in traffic and a of 5 week ago my doctor started me on metformin 500mg twice a day i am seeing an endo and she put me on metformin just to try it because she can't come up with anything else we have done blood work after blood work the only thing it showed recently wa my rbc count wa getting a little high my fasting cortisol and insulin have been normal i have had chest and head xrays and mri's and they found nothing i have seen a neurologist and he found nothing so i came across a post on r brainfog touting the effectiveness of going full keto lifestyle initiated thanks to strict medical follow up on pronokal i think some background story is appropriate i've been always a sport kind of guy through high school and early twenty however after 25 i started to gain weight slow at first and probably some can relate that each time i wa on the scale you say to yourself this isn't that bad if you keep doing this get le active because of a hectic professional and personal life and include eating out or choosing fast food instead of cooking up something decent it add up pretty fast fast forward to the present at 38 and the weight scale showed a scaring 102 kg 224 pound now before i had tried keto with success the first time i saw that i wa going to +100kg i managed to get it back down to 94kg 207 pound which is still too heavy since i'm 1m75 5 foot 8 57 64 inch but i wa on a roll right then covid happened seated at home permanently but lucky enough to still have work bread and pasta were within arm reach and i started to gain weight again and an alarming rate until present day having failed to stick to a keto lifestyle since we all know it's not a diet i decided that i needed guidance pronokal i'm not sure how popular or familiar people are with the pronokal method but in belgium it's a kind of diet under the supervision of a doctor every two week i check in measurement are taken and every four week my blood get tested the diet consists of pronokal product of their own combined with 400 gram 1 1 2 cup of largely green vegetable very restricted which one are allowed once you reach a certain target weight you progress to the next step where you'll replace some of their own product with lean meat or chicken for instance at the end you should be eating more or le keto ish i know or believe they re introduce carbs into the diet a well at some point but i'm far from that moment in time the doctor checkup continues up until two year after your last step to make sure you made the correct food adaption and don't relapse a lot of question remain to be answered but it seems that i really need the doctor follow up to motivate me and to continue progress i started this new adventure on march 15th at 102kg 224 pound and the scale this morning after a month indicated 90 7kg 199 95 pound so that's a loss of about 11 kg 24 pound in one month i'm sure the weight loss will slow down after this initial step 1 once i introduce different kind of food again surprise i'm really surprised that i don't miss the carbs sugar etc i used to really enjoy food having two plate of pasta and ice cream afterwards eating lot of bread each day and drinking zero beverage i wa afraid i'd miss all those don't get me wrong we're a family of four and i'm the only one on a diet it's not difficult but sure the smell of french fry with steak from the other people in the family smell delicious but i think a key factor to the success of this and keto in general is that there are no craving i'm full after eating feeling full for a long time and mental clarity is insane i used to be one of those people that would forget anything unless i wrote it down in some todo list or a note app right now i remember work related discussion from four week ago like they happened yesterday it's still a long journey ahead until i reach my target weight of 73kg 161 pound but right now it's looking great and most important i'm feeling great

the keto plan i gave my sister so many people have messaged me or asked on my earlier post what i told her when she asked me how i'd lost the weight and i told her about keto i thought i'd post it here a always i urge you to read this sub's faq it's been my rock and i'm not even exaggerating i basically summarized the faq plus my own little intervention try to keep your carbs under 20 a day but if you do go over don't let it derail you just keep them a low a you can for the rest of the day lean into protein make sure you're getting at least 100 gram a day even if you need to go over your deficit calorie to get there drink ketoade and use salt on your food i gave her the faq recipe weigh and track your food a much a you can again if you can't don't let it derail you do your best and keep going use a food tracker all the time every day if you stop start again when you can she us carbmanager i did but now use cronometer if there is something you really want and will feel deprived and resentful without it make sure you're already full if you can and have one bite of the thing count it a 5 carbs it probably won't be that much and then get rid of the rest the first bite is always the best anyway be kind to yourself this is not a punishment it's not that you can't have carbs it's that you don't want them if you stop eating keto you're not cheating you're just not eating keto it will be there when you're ready to come back to it that's pretty much it when she's had question i've answered them she told me she's gone off keto sometimes but always gotten back on with the next meal keto on everyone

is the keto diet right for you although the conversation about the ketogenic diet is widespread many people still find it challenging to tell what is fact or fiction in this article you will gain insight into the myth and fact surrounding the ketogenic diet what is exactly is a keto diet the keto diet work on the principle that by depleting carbohydrate you will burn fat for fuel hence maximizing weight loss it entail a gradual reduction of carbs intake and replacing it with fat keto diet myth fact here are the common keto diet myth and fact myth 1 you can consume any fat fact when practicing ketogenic people consume healthy fat if you want to keep fit avoid saturated fat and focus on organic food rich in fiber to prevent any stomach discomfort space out the quantity of your daily fat intake myth 2 weight loss is the only benefit of keto diet fact contrary to what many believe the keto diet ha immense benefit other than weight loss for instance it enhances cognitive function boost gut health regulates body hormone and stabilizes blood sugar level myth 3 you don't need to exercise fact exercising is highly recommended when you are on a keto diet however to achieve more out of workout ensure you eat adequately and allow enough time for recovery to exercise you may need more carbs and it is essential to up your carb consumption on workout day myth 4 your muscle mass will reduce fact a opposed to the myth people who follow the diet while doing strength exercise gain muscle myth 4 it is characterized by fatigue fact during the adjustment period of the diet you i didn t relapse i m in absolute awe of myself firstly let me say i call it relapsing because a a recovering alcoholic and drug addict i know when i want something v when i m clucking for it i m a year and two week sober and in replacement of the sauce and sparkle i used food i m now 5 7 and 92kg long and short the floor board squeak i have been on keto for two week i ve logged my food i ve nailed my cooking and i have absolutely bloody loved it yoga everyday walk everyday building up little by little to the healthiest me but today i had a vision of getting a massive cake with icing i saw it on tv the type of cake you want to buy a drink and lick all over and i wanted to stick a fork in it and eat it until i felt sick and bin the rest i don t even like cake it wa never my thing but i had that addict twinge i knew sugar wa going to be tough to ditch but after you ve given up cocaine and champagne sugar wa the lesser of two evil so i thought i realised recently if i kept giving in to sugar pretty soon i wa going to give in to alcohol again if i can t acknowledge and address these addict tick that set me off and cut them off i m going to relapse so i turned back around i stopped walking to my local bakery turned around and came back home made an enormous cup of camomile tea and meditated i found a higher power somewhere along the way today i am grateful to be a part of this community and i am so grateful i have a safe space to share my small triumph god bless x

arguing dirty v clean keto is stupid i've been doing keto for 4 year i primarily do it for it's anti inflammatory and low acid property along with all the other goodness one of the coolest thing i've seen throughout those four year is local store packing new low carb and keto friendly option it's make a sustainable keto lifestyle a lot more cost effective and realistic for example there are literally six different keto bread i can purchase from a number of store in my neighborhood there's pasta keto bakery fucking cereal waffle and all type of new shit and yet there's so much animosity from people staunchly approaching keto with a eat clean mindset a if a function of keto isn't to clean your innards and sure it's fine do a you please what's not fine is dismissing others who have managed to integrate keto into their life their way there are so many new folk that get railed by asshats that have convinced themselves anything processed is anti keto and i believe these folk hurt the keto community personally i think clean dirty keto is bullshit some people have trouble with moderation so they choose a label to help them maintain their goal but in the end nutritional ketosis is nutritional ketosis how you maintain that doesn't matter a long a it work and is healthy for you

i m changing my life with keto without changing my habit i m 53m 6 1 in the last 30 year i ve been always overweight i went trough a lot of different trial in order to go down with my weight in 2013 i tried dukan and i ve got good result with 40lbs loss that nutrition wa very difficult to maintain moreover i had also few health negative consequence after i interrupted it i bounced back to 260lbs then i tried a low cal balanced diet i had a relatively lower weight loss and it wa again very difficult to follow this kind of nutrition my dream ha been to go back under 220lbs 100kg i wa really upset that even though in the past i got the target i d not been able to stay there i wa quite desperate and i couldn t control my weight at all and i reached again and again 260lbs one year ago while i wa struggling with my last low fat low cal diet with actual poor result and lot of hardship i wa told about keto and the incredible result you can achieve with it i started with keto and i have to admit initially it wa very difficult big difficulty for me wa to give up on my beloved pasta and pizza and that s a real sacrifice considering i m italian i wa almost to give up when luckily one year ago a friend of mine introduced an italian brand specialized in low card food to they offer pasta bread cake all with very low carb content around 5gr cho 100gr there are also preparation to make pasta bread pizza and cake home everything taste delicious you wouldn t be even able to recognize difference with high carb food this way i m now able to eat all my beloved dish keeping my carbohydrate lower than 25gr a day eating in such a way eventually i hit my target few month ago and i m going further down my current weight is 210lbs 95kg i haven t felt my self so good and energetic since my twenty i will stay on keto forever that s only joy and fun and no sacrifice at all

doctor success went to my new doctor today wa all prepared to give him an education on why keto isn't going to kill me and why my lab look great and i should stop taking my statin soon a he walked in and saw my weight loss he asked if i wa doing keto i wa ready for a smackdown but when i confirmed it he smiled and said awesome job then he went on for 20 minute about how healthy keto is and how he's been bouncing between actual keto and just very low carb for over a year and hasn't felt better then he asked me if i'd be ok with him discontinuing my statin and doing another lipid panel in 6 month to confirm i'm fine without them before i had a chance to bring it up so yeah couldn't have gone better despite me being anxious about having to argue with him about keto it's nice to see that doctor are starting to get up to speed on this stuff finally

after 2 week on clean keto processed fast food made me feel disgusted and unsatisfied i'm writing this post because i thought this might encourage some people to continue on their keto journey backstory i used to be 203lbs 5'9 male back in august now at 164lbs after tonight cheat meal maybe at 169lbs i do back to back water fasting and keto on eating day i eat virtually no sugar on keto not even artificial sugar it seems like my weight loss had stalled at 164 lb so i thought take a break from keto and eat whatever i wanted to get my leptin level up i still ate keto i just couldn't order anything off of uber eats for some reason i just craved broccoli and spinach with a hamburger patty with cheese so i had that for lunch and the same meal for dinner with an organic cookie half of a brownie and some chocolate pretzel so an hour ago i said to myself i need more carbs so i finally went with something on uber eats i went with wendy's i got some nugget fry and a burger big mistake the food tasted so badddddddddddddd like ewwwwww my organic burger tasted way better than the wendy's burger after all these year i finally know why people say to avoid processed food cause i feel like shit now i felt like the meal i had wa not wholesome at all their wa no feeling of pleasure while eating the food so don't give up you may have carb craving or junk food craving and honestly it's not worth it stay on keto and your gut microbiome will crave healthier food

psa bang keto coffee at 7 11 ha sucralose which cause insulin spike iow not necessarily ketotic there's a 7 11 right next to our house and i stopped in while walking the dog this morning a coffee can with the word keto emblazoned across it caught my eye the brand is bang i'm sure they are well intentioned creating a sweetened coffee product with almost zero net carbs and 20g protein but the idea that just having zero net carbs is what put people in ketosis is a very rudimentary understanding of ketosis a lot of people who continue to drink sucralose splenda or aspartame sweet n low product while on keto diet will often become frustrated that they are not in deep ketosis insulin spiking sweetener are often the culprit sweetener such a stevia and monkfruit do not cause an insulin spike but they taste weird if you can tolerate them that's great otherwise try to just drink cold brew or straight coffee

keto+ omad saved my life ill start by saying i share this story to try to inspire others who are in a similar situation i'd also like to thank the kind folk here at r keto for the support and great tip i am now approaching 4 month on the ketogenic lifestyle and have never felt better within a few short month i have went from obese and depressed to truly a new person i still have those pesky stretch mark but besides those my body ha loved the lifestyle change and trust me being skinny and having stretch mark is a whole lot better than being fat with stretch mark if you are on the fence about starting keto please take the leap and just go for it the appetite suppression is one of my absolute favorite part about keto it ha this weird way of making the diet turn into a healthy lifestyle i never set a goal for myself and just kept trying to stay consistent with my macro i am blessed to have lost almost 60lbs so far on my keto journey i am finally approaching my goal weight but have no plan to stop keto people say keto is a fad and they couldn't be more wrong keto truly ha turned my life around for the better and i figured posting in the place which gave me the most support would be a fitting end to a great day thank you r keto

high h crp i ve been working with my doctor the last 8 month to identify the cause of my high h crp we re are fairly sure it not associated with diet but rather my actual body fat level this seems like a catch 22 the fat is causing my chronic inflammation but chronic inflammation inhibits several pathway involved in fat mobilization and metabolism i still have at least 50 pound before i get to my goal weight i m currently eating 2 25 pound of 90 20 ground sirloin 2oz beef liver heart pate 6 egg yolk 1 tbps of butter a quarter cup of olive 1 can of sardine in water 8oz of beef broth i have none of the classic symptom of inflammation like brain fog or ache joint i lift full body 3 day a week and walk 4 mile daily i have also been fasting for 2 day the last month my issue isn t that i m not losing weight i m curious if their are any novel treatment idea that can address my inflammation so i can maximize my next 8 week of this fat loss phase every other marker of health is perfect from fasting insulin to lipid

a warning about electrolyte i have been on keto for several month and thought i should share a keto caused negative health related experience i had recently that at the time really frieked me out but once i did some more research i wa able to remedy and prevent in the future i had been doing omad keto lazy just counting carbs for a few month when i started to get some aching pain in my foot and knee a well a had a couple night where i had pretty bad leg cramp i didn't really pay much attention and actually thought i wa dehydrated so i started drinking more water on a regular basis i think this wa a mistake because over time the pain got slightly worse and one day i actually ended up having my vision go blurry very suddenly and i developed an absolutely horrible headache that hospitalized me i've never had headache like this one could definitely be classified a a migrane a it wa absolutely unbearable those of you with more keto experience probably already know what happened they ran test and everything looked normal i did however have potassium on the low end of normal a well a sodium and magnesium were in the lower end i did some more research which i should have done in the first place and it became very clear that i wa not consuming enough electrolyte i am starting to think supplementing electrolyte during long term keto is something that should really be pushed a a necessity for newcomer i do wonder how many people end up writing off this diet because they had an experience like mine since the event i have been supplementing 400mg of potassium and magnesium and 1000mg of sodium per day since i started i gave felt all around much better both mentally and physically while in ketosis tldr i wasn't supplementing electrolyte on omad keto and i ended up being hospitalized with the most painful headache i've ever had supplementing ha fixed my issue and made me feel better

tip for ketogenic diet 1 drink water before and after meal to suppress hunger and make you feel fuller 2 stay hydrated it's just healthy and help any form of weight loss 3 get some exercise in nothing crazy 30 minute of walking is all you need maybe 3 7 time a day exercising is not required for weight loss in keto diet 4 try to eat a far into the day a possible so you don't end up eating too often 5 limit how many meal you eat a day to avoid feeling on a keto diet you shouldn't feel hungry very often because your body is in ketosis so take advantage of that to decrease caloric intake make sure to diversify your food and get some veggie in to get proper nutrition 6 avoid environment where non keto food are available this is obvious but very important if for example your family is eating cooky in the kitchen stay in your room doing something else 7 keep in mind that the beginning of starting a keto diet is the hardest then your craving will go away and so is your appetite 8 you can still overeat on keto no matter what diet or exercise plan you're on if you're overeating you'll see le result make sure that you're eating slowly and not having big proportion 9 best to limit yourself up to 20 carbs it's a limit not a goal you don't have to try to hit 20 carbs realize that this is the recommended maximum to guarantee ketosis 10 if you mess up it's okay i didn't stick to the keto diet on my first try you have so many more time to try again forgive yourself realize you can't change the past and move on

made new lifestyle change and wondering if what i eat would be considered keto food http i gyazo com fa3d787b5b239e8182bb05c2bf86b350 png so in march after losing out on gme and a lot of research into carbs and sugar documentary and more etc but that's le dramatic i decided to completely change my lifestyle and started a 1 week fast and then slowly moved to a 22 hour intermittent fasting slowly adding healthy food then after a bit i started swapping stuff around then adding exercise i decided to add a salad to the diet and experimented with eating time now eating 2 10 pm salad wise and 6 30 7 pm during the main meal i eat the walnut and dark chocolate right after dinner so i count it a a main meal time which i assume would count a a 6 hour eating window even though i only eat twice though i can feel the difference from extremely unhealthy junk food and irn bru fizzy drink every day to this diet i lost about 15 18kg from the fast alone though i plateaued a bit from then a i stayed at 120kg for 2 week this could be from countless of thing and i also started to do 1 hour walk every day in the morning and pushed my waking up time to 6 15 am so hopefully that speed up the system health and metabolic wise

kendra s keto journey i m closer than ever to my goal weight i have energy to do thing with my child kendra say can a keto diet help you lose 100 pound 45 kilo boost your energy level and gain an interest in exercising yes all these thing happened to kendra thanks to the low carb high fat lchf diet i m closer than ever to my goal weight i have energy to do thing with my child kendra say here s kendra s inspiring story which ha been lightly edited for length and clarity kendra s keto journey my name is kendra i m 32 year old and i live in the u midwest i started following the keto diet in april 2018 since then i ve lost over 100 pound 45 kilo initially it wasn t easy i used to overdo it on snack sweet and fast food my portion size were out of control i realized that not only wa i setting myself up for health issue like diabetes congestive heart failure and high blood pressure that run in my family but i wa setting my child up for the same i decided enough wa enough a friend told me about the keto diet and the success she wa having and i started the next day these day i cook at home and we rarely eat out i ve learned how to cook a variety of healthy and delicious meal i can make just about any dish keto friendly i ve also incorporated intermittent fasting on most day my eating window is 12 pm to 8 pm and at least one day a week i do one meal a day of course there have been time when i ve eaten high carb food but eating these food only made me realize that my body just doesn t agree with them low carb is what work best for me to learn more contact sararubinstein00 gmail com remove space

any restart keto pointer i posted similar 2 day ago but somehow disappeared keto for march strict adherence except early on when i misunderstood some key idea and didnt have macro correct end of march here wa easter last week and in denmark thats a 5 day long weekend with lot of visit and visiting so i just relaxed for 5 day restarted on monday with 1551kcal 154p 20c 95f along with intermittent fasting 16 8 my weight fluctuates so much that it hard to say if i really gained weight back but for sure beer candy and pasta were on the menu not worried about it i ran for 45 minute yesterday felt strong so for sure glycogen store available plan to run again today maybe a bit longer to burn out my leg then do a 24 hour fast sound like a plan postnote enjoyed the pasta and goody but had a decent amount of unexpected guilt surrounding this i mention because i think many would agree in the course of a year there will be time where it just very practical to suspend the strictness i know i want to continue with the macro etc for a few reason i feel better for one but learning how to navigate these schedule is a good skill that month of being strict got easier and easier then now restarting is second nature almost i think that will become the norm for me any changing of macro and kcal will be a function of targeted carbs etc once other workout are introduced after the lockdown is over we'll see

don't give up just wanted to share a bit about my journey i have posted a picture of me at my daughter's birthday party in october of last year and a picture of me present day i have tried multiple different diet pill drink bar and just about everything else you could think of one of my closest friend wa nearly 400lbs when his dr told him that his life wa in danger and he needed to make a change he researched the keto diet and started it i wa amazed at his result after seeing myself in those picture at my daughter bday i decided to give it a try at first i felt stupid for trying another diet that would most assuredly fail i felt like an idiot eating my hotdog and burger without bun i felt like a girly man switching from ipa beer to no carb seltzer i missed gorging myself in pasta and bread and doughnut oh my god the doughnut but i told myself i would give it an honest try for a week and see what happens i weighed in at the end of that week and had lost 4lbs it wa full speed ahead from there the real reason i wanted to make this post is because there were multiple time in the last 7 month that i wa stuck at one weight range and thought i would never lose anymore it frustrated the hell out of me but i stuck to it you have to stick to it at one point it took me an entire month to get from 247 to 245 i started a 20 minute hit workout on my rowing machine 3 time a week and went fully religious on the keto diet i gave myself a goal to get to 230lbs because that is the weight that google told me i would no longer be obese at my height lol in the picture at my daughter's party i wa 283lbs today i weighed in at 231 if you are stuck and you are frustrated i came here today to say don't stop get more physical drink more water you can do this keto weight loss http keto weight loss http imgur com a y45kv5f

54 day later 51 pound down sorry for the sob story but i wanted to share my progress after wrestling with alcoholism for over a decade and a half i decided it wa time to stop the cycle before i turned 30 in that time i had an incredibly complex and unhealthy relationship with food i wa always overweight but wa able to maintain a active lifestyle participating in sport year round after moving to the big city for work when i wa 26 i began a sedentary lifestyle and drank over a 5th of alcohol 4 7 day a week for 4 year and gained 100lbs in the process this isn t a sobriety sub so i ll skip to keto 6 month into sobriety i began strictly monitoring my nutrition using carb manager and a food scale after 2 week of tweaking my diet i finally started seeing the pound melt off i m under 400lbs for the first time in 3 year with a goal weight of 260 i am 6 3 and haven t been under 300lbs since i wa 5 inch shorter and 15 year younger realizing nutrition wa a part of life and not just a short term diet made the whole process much easier and le daunting wish me luck tl dr quit the booze lost 51 pound much more to come

any other t1d's sick of other t1d's being anti keto i am a t1d of almost 18 year with a normal a1c i acheived this through low carb when you're diagnosed they tell you to keep your a1c a low a possible to decrease the risk of complication decrease but not eliminate people who have well controlled diabetes still get complication and it happens often i am in a few group for diabetes on different social medium platform i occasionally leave comment on post mentioning that i have a normal a1c and people occasionally inquire about it so i talk to them i wa recently talking to the mother of a 6 year old who wa diagnosed at the end of last year she asked how i got to a normal a1c so i explained after a while she started asking if i ate normally on vacation i told her no because my basal rate and carb ratio are all programmed for low carb so i'd go through the roof if i started eating carbs again and on top of that if i'm on vacation i definitely don't want to risk ruining my day with roller coaster blood sugar her response wa that she wanted her daughter to be normal and not live with so many restriction i wa left scratching my head having food restriction is far from unusual in this day and age and furthermore isn't going blind having your foot amputated and being on dialysis more restrictive than not eating a candy bar i've also been told that the keto diet is dangerous and unhealthy and a whole bunch of other thing i just don't understand how people can argue against keto the result of which can clearly be seen and then turn around and wonder why their blood sugar is 400+ and they don't feel well

keto tip for beginner hi new to this group but have been doing keto for 2 month now and it ha really changed my life i m 2 month in and 29 lb down my confidence ha increased dramatically and i wa surprised out how stable my mood been no more mood swing or day where i ve felt unhappy for no reason whatsoever at first i found it hard due to me being a big snacker and worst of all snacking on carb heavy food like sandwich anything that s easy to grab basically but once you figure out what food you can have and what food to avoid it s actually very easy to adjust your lifestyle to implement keto my advice to anyone new is to do your research the faq ha a lot of great info on keto and it s laid out in a way that s easy for beginner to understand another page i found http site google com view ketodietfactsonline home is very good aswell quick and to the point which is how i like to live my life no big long article to read just info summarised to help you i also signed up for the keto meal plan they have on the website but it definitely isn t necessary it just helped me because i m very busy and work 55 hour a week so it saved me time in trying to think of recipe to make and all that jazz it definitely worked anyway so if anyone s busy it s a very good plan to follow the main thing to remember is keto work summer just around the corner but with keto you can have the body of your dream by then it can be tough but just think of the result let me know what all of your experience have been like i love hearing a good success story

blood glucose and weight loss i'm a type 2 diabetic eschewing med so i've been doing keto+if and tracking both my blood glucose level and weight daily my diet ha been pretty consistent for the past several week since i started tracking all this my fasting blood glucose bg ha been low 90 mg dl to low 100 and are typically between 110 and 120 2 hour after a meal every now and then i'll get a postprandial bg reading that's between 15 to 20 mg dl higher than usual it's not necessarily because of what i've eaten a i said i've been eating pretty consistently i'll just rotate through some group of food over and over so this just mean that for whatever reason the same low carb meal that i typically eat will cause my bg to increase when this happens almost without fail my weight the following morning will be between 0 6 and a full pound lower than the previous morning i'm not sure if the higher bg is causing me to piss more or something but there seems to be a correlation note though that i am not advocate that you eat more carbs to cause your bg to go up i'm just saying that on the occasion that my typical keto meal cause my bg to go up for whatever reason it seems to be a precursor to a drop in weight

nsv loose watch and wedding ring and adam's apple oh my just wanted to share a few nsv's i've experienced recently i started my keto journey for the 3rd or 4th time on december 15th so i'm coming up on 4 month of keto while in the past i've succumbed to cheat day that just never ended or went on vacation where it wa very difficult to find food that wa keto friendly this pandemic ha actually helped me i haven't had a single cheat day that i would consider a cheat day i've generally kept to le than 20g carbs per day only once or twice going up to 35 40 i'm mostly omad but sometimes tmad on weekend i don't really snack throughout the day and whenever i feel those hunger pang i just drink water until i'm full and that satiates me for a while i started at around 325 that's my best guess i don't know exactly because a i wa afraid to step on the scale and b my scale doesn't go above 300 i'm currently at about 275 so around 50 pound lost in 4 month while i have seemed to plateau a little bit scale weight wise recently seemed to be stuck around 280 for a couple week that ha begun dropping again i've found that when washing my hand my wedding ring fall off if i'm not careful and it's super loose regularly i usually take it off when cooking dinner a i wash my hand frequently and sometimes forget to put it back on my husband ha even brought it to me asking if i wa planning on leaving him since i keep leaving it place lol unfortunately it's made of titanium so it can't be resized but we only bought cheap ring at the start of our marriage with the intention of getting nicer one in the future maybe this is the impetus for that i recently found a fitbit and decided to charge it and wear it some more i haven't worn it in probably 6 month and now it's so loose that i need to take another link out of the strap most noticeable to me wa that i can actually see my adam's apple now i went so long not even realizing i couldn't see it but my neck wa so fat that it wa hidden now that i can see it again i notice how many of my facial feature have changed and it's all the more motivation to keep going i truly have this subreddit to thank for all the encouragement recipe and general info

3 week of keto and i gained 3 pound i'm about to give up 48 yo female 5'7 cw 165 gw 135 i started keto three week ago after not being able to lose any weight with week of 16 8 intermittent fasting i'm not someone who ha ever been able to count calorie or limit portion so it seemed like keto wa the diet for me i read about which food to avoid and which were allowed and made it my goal to consumer no more than 20g of carbs per day not net carbs but total carbs because i didn't weigh portion or count calorie i can't be sure i always made the target but here is what i did check the label on everything that ha a label to make sure not to accidentally consume too many carbs cut out sugar and anything with added sugar occasionally using a pinch of monkfruit to sweeten my coffee or whipped cream absolutely nothing carb heavy such a bread rice or pasta no legume ate fish seafood and meat including beef chicken pork and sausage either sauteed or grilled and without breading plenty of egg vegetable including snap pea fennel green avocado radish cabbage broccoli and asparagus carrot and cherry tomato in small amount fruit raspberry blackberry and blueberry about 1 2 to 1 cup a day heavy cream in my coffee and whipped on my berry spirit such a gin and vodka a well a hard seltzer 2g of carbs each this wa a huge change to my diet it wa difficult and i wa sometimes miserable the first week i felt physically ill and didn't have a lot of appetite the next 2 week i felt normal no change to the amount of exercise i get which is not a lot mostly walking for the first 2 week my weight didn't change at the end of the third week i had gained 3 pound i've read on here about people counting calorie fasting with keto doing macro don't understand that etc i just don't think i could stick with a diet that required too much calculating should i give up on keto doe it just not work for some people

get a nice craft ish tasting beer by adding hop pre keto i looooved my beer i wa the guy going to craft beer fests whenever i could after starting keto i gave up my beloved brewskies and then i found molson ultra and michelob ultra 3 amp 4 carb beer they're pretty generic tasting thing but when you want a cold beer on a hot day it did the trick i wa in my friend's backyard and he wa telling me how there is hop growing on the fence line we were checking it out because plant are neat he told me that if you chew on it not eat it taste like a hoppy beer i did he wa right he let me pick some i took it home chopped it up and mixed it into a can of low carb beer i did not drink it right then and there but rather i put it in the fridge in a sealed container i waited about 3 day then i strained some out and used it a more of a flavour shot in a new can of beer and bam le boring low carb beer now it's true there is a small amount of carbonation lost but i'd say a pretty negligible amount have fun

i did not loose weight on keto after 1 year but i did loose 10 body fat and gained even more muscle self esteem and cognitive skill link http imgur com a ag2id4w first i want to say that this transformation is nothing compared to what i ve seen in this sub weight wise you guy are amazing but we all have our struggle regardless of the weight of the scale and this shit is about taking responsibility for yourself and your value your self esteem is the reputation that you have with yourself and it s always watching you to see if you re living through your value so a year ago little before my birthday i felt horrible i worked 72h w in a sale job i wa doing great sale wise with all time high record here and there but that shit doesn t matter i still destroyed my body and mind you know just to be able to sustain the long and intensive day i had to constantly eat i ate 6 tasty cheese every fricking day + breakfast and dinner that s just absurd but of course understandable considering the huge amount of stress the job gave me in combination with not living truthfully with myself after reflecting deeply on my value i decided to quit my job and pursue what i wanted which wa running why own company and getting my grade up so i did just that i decided that i wanted to have a body fat of 15 and hit 120kg bench press which i thought wa impossible at first so i did just that this is actually about deciding who you want to be and sustain meaningful effort amp suffering because suffering is not bad it s quite good well it s actually a gift to be able to suffer for something meaningful and is the fundamental thing for most success but if you have no direction and no meaning behind the suffering it s a recipe for all kind of mental disorder which will lead to other negative consequence anyway subscribe like and comment also buy my new book and merch and sticker and signatured air in a bottle link in bio no but seriously thank you for reading this

my first post ever on reddit is a thank you to this sub i've been reddit user for over 2 year but this is my first post and it's a huge thank you to this sub i've tried keto several time before over they year and lost 10 ish pound before falling off the wagon each time i started reading this sub in late 2020 for inspiration and to learn 2020 wa hard for me like everyone which caused some stress baking and the correlating stress eating in addition i had a severe 2nd degree ankle sprain in january 2020 followed by a horrible bout of sciatica in october 2020 that plagued me into the new year i wa sick and tired of feeling sick and tired and painful and i knew my weight of 205 lb at 5'5 and age 40 wasn't helping thing at all i knew i needed to shed some pound to be able to get active without pain i made the lifestyle change one random day in mid january 2021 i don't remember exactly which day i just remember which week i stayed on top of my electrolyte and macro with carbmanager and while the first week wa hard after that i wa feeling pretty good minimal keto flu then the positive change started i previously suffered a form of insomnia couldn't stay asleep through the night which disappeared pretty quickly i live with adhd which i've never needed to medicate to function but holy moly i have a mental clarity that i have never known before my back pain and ankle pain have basically disappeared whether it's directly due to weight loss or reduction in inflammation i don't know and i don't care either no matter how you slice it this lifestyle is doing amazing thing for me so this gal sat at 205lbs somewhere in mid january yesterday i broke through 180 to land at 178 6 i credit reading the great advice and motivational story on this sub with my success i wa stuck around 184 for a couple of week until i read here that i should recalculate my macro every 10lbs down and that really the only macro i needed to hit or exceed wa protein and to eat fat to satiety rather than trying to hit the macro these 2 thing together made the scale move down again i started obese and a of yesterday i'm down to the overweight category though i believe bmi is mostly bullshit but i don't have body fat caliper or anything else to help me calculate where i'm at health wise and have reduced some health risk factor my first goal is to get to 170lbs still overweight but i feel it's a midway marker for me my ultimate goal is to get to about 140 lb and feeling strong i may go to maintenance sooner if i feel i've made it because i don't want to be skinny i want to be strong healthy and confident again thank you everyone who's contributing regularly with reading your story and tip i don't feel like stepping off this path one bit

keto round 3 so a little about my keto experience i tried it a few year ago with little success after not doing much research and not being a strict that lasted a month or so with little result went back to normal eating habit cut to a month before the pandemic got serious i started up keto with my gf at the time really serious with it counting calorie and meal prepping who would of thought it could be successful if you dedicate to it a few month into the pandemic with lockdown in full force i'm down probably 40 or so lb relationship ended and she moved out but that motivated me for some reason and about september or so i wa at a huge milestone of almost being under 200lbs i started at nearly 280 i costed for another could month and got really close to getting into the 100 i'm pretty sure there wa a month where i wa depressed and lost motivation so i got off of keto thinking i could control my calorie intake and start working out this didn't work out my urge to overeat came back and i fully fell off the wagon so that wa 4 or so month back i'm back up to around 260 i'm living in a new apartment got my first vaccine coming up finally thing may go back to normal i'm currently on a business trip which requires me to live from a hotel for a couple week at a time i'm ready to go back to keto and finally get under 200 i know it's possible i think i may just have to stay on keto forever otherwise i just eat eat eat keto kept my hunger in check i wa hoping that this summer i would be beach ready but i got knocked on my as my father died at 57 from a heart attack i have heart disease in my family i need to become healthier otherwise i won't last longer i'm just coming on here to vent and write down my thought and maybe get some encouragement that is something we can all use here is hoping i can get my goal of under 200 on the future tldr i tried keto with success the second time lost 75 lb but i got off keto and now i'm starting again

keto rash acne breakout dermatitis hi everyone i've been on keto for about 7 week now and i've been loving my progress so far i am 5'9 and weighed at 178 at the start and i am now 168 after 7 week i work out about 5 6 time per week and lost roughly about 3 body fat on the 6th week i started to notice some rash on my neck back and it eventually spread to my chest keto rash i began to have acne breakout on my face and it just kept getting worse overtime i did some research and decided to try out some bile salt like super enzyme on amazon this is what made my keto rash go away over a course of 3 day i also tried to up my carb intake to about 20 30 net gram until my rash got completely healed however my ance wa still getting worse for some reason i noticed that it started breaking out ever since i stopped eating salad everyday my face wa inflammed and itchy after every meal with high fat i wa breaking out like crazy even after washing my face 2 3 time daily i began to eat spinach kale mushroom and swiss chard every single day for every meal after incorporating vegetable back into my diet i began to see the acne go away significantly over 3 day this ha worked for me and i just wanted to share this in hope that it can work for those who are dealing with this a well

the effect sleep can have hello all just wanted a place to put this out there long story short been keto before and successfully lost 30 lb had a baby and gained it all back and then some i ve been off and on since a couple month post partum and have just been too stressed overwhelmed exhausted for it to stick little one is almost 10 month and although teething is killing u right now we re in a decent spot given this i hopped back on this past monday and have been successful again lost about 5 lb feeling in control with only a few hard moment that i ultimately defeated however in one night i gained 3 lb and i believe this is due to lack of sleep i fasted until lunch wa within macro barely over calorie wa done eating by 6 45 and had a good 40 minute walk when all of those thing line up i can expect to lose something based on all of my experience even if it s 5 lb it s something well i gained 3 2 lb and i can guarantee you it s because i slept on the couch last night and got just about zero sleep my baby girl had a rough night and when that s the case and my husband is home he work night i will go to the couch this is because he s up most of the night because his own sleep is completely jacked due to work and he can t stand to hear her cry to honestly make it easier for everyone i go to the living room and close the door so he can t hear her and i don t feel pressure to go against the sleep training i ve successfully done with her most of the time i don t have that much trouble getting some sleep but last night i just couldn t get right maybe some other factor contributed to the gain but i believe this to be the biggest factor it s crazy how it can effect it so greatly my husband is back at work tonight i ll be back in bed and hopefully baby ha a better night for a happier scale in the morning haha

3 month update 52 4 lb lost after year of being big i got tired of my foot hurting all the time figured my weight had some role in that so i started looking into keto after a niece had some success with it i have a job that keep me in the car most of the day and wa eating fast food almost every day i had no idea my current weight because my wife's bathroom scale wouldn't go that high wa guessing i wa around 325 330 started researching the diet read the faq tried a few recipe and ordered a new scale it arrived on the evening of 12 28 i weighed myself after dinner i know and wa surprised to see i wa 350 6 lb yes i needed to lose weight i officially started keto on 1 1 21 at 343 4lbs i initially bought way too much food because i wasn't yet sure how much i'd eat on a given day i know the recommendation is to do a 20 deficit but i went with 35 and have maintained that throughout that give me a low fat macro and about 1500 calorie per day now that's a big step down from before when i'd sometimes have 4000 calorie in one meal i'm not kidding i started with simple meal eventually tried a few recipe some i liked and some i didn't i've now gotten into a pretty good routine and vary my dinner through different meat and veggie while keeping brunch about the same each day i've had a few week long stall along the way i don't eat out hardly at all anymore and when i do it usually lead to a slight weight gain despite reading menu nutrition chart and keeping my number down after one fairly long stall i decided to try a fast only water 11pm sunday to 2pm tuesday and that helped a lot to get it started again on 4 1 i weighed 291 lb no april fool there if i can keep up the 15 lb mo loss rate then i'll be at my initial goal of 210 by halloween according to the height weight chart my ideal weight is about 180 lb not sure if that's doable or desired but i'll decide when i get close to the first goal for a long time i made excuse that dieting cost too much because healthy food cost more than unhealthy food and i'm not wealthy it's cheaper to buy a pack of hot dog and a box of mac n cheese than broccoli and chicken well that's true but i've found i have more money in the bank now than i did then i might go spend 150 at the grocery store usually le but then i feed myself two meal per day for two week or more compare that to a 15 or more every day in the drive thru for one meal in the same timeframe at 210+ i've finally convinced my wife to try it a she's been wanting to lose some weight 5'0 at 127 lb and she started on 4 1 at a 20 deficit she committed to 30 under 20 for now then she'll decide if she want to continue she's a big bread chocolate and milk fan so i'm finding some sub for her anyhoo i'm pleased with the progress so far i've gone down 2 pant size and am close to going down another had to buy a new belt my seatbelt isn't a tight a it used to be and my foot still hurt some but not a bad or a often a before

nsv keto had changed my relationship with food for better so back at the end of february i m 23 6'0 started keto cold turkey i started at 265 pound eating probably close to 3000 calorie a day if not more even back in my college athletics day i wa a rower for a d1 club team my relationship with food to put it lightly wa a coping mechanism feeling sad eat feeling depressed eat bored eat it wasn't healthy and i knew i needed to change something so after doing a lot of research i determined keto wa the best fit for me and even though it's recommended to slowly transition in i just went full in i count my macro and weigh food out and at the beginning it wa hard fighting the urge to cheat but i didn't give in and a time went on the craving went away i started walking more and just getting outside in general and after over a month i realized something i don't need to eat to feel better or just because i'm bored i need to eat when i'm hungry to live and yea i can snack from time to time but food is for sustenance not something to pas the time and in that epiphany i realized why keto work for me it cut out my craving and made me feel fuller longer it made me genuinely take stock of what i eat and get smarter about what i'm putting in my body my goal is 200 and a of today i'm down to 238 but what impress me the most is not that weight loss it's that keto ha made my relationship with food into a healthy one i may not stay on keto forever probably going to carb cycling but the lesson keto is teaching me now are going to last me the rest of my life and i'll be better off for it

what are your go to recommended keto brand amp product a someone who did this diet a few year ago and is now coming back to it i am amazed at how many new keto friendly product are available these day i would like to compile a list of go to product please share what your favorite keto product are these don't have to specifically be keto branded product but anything you regularly buy from the grocery store amp x200b some of my favorite and their net carbs per serving in parenthesis pasta sauce rao's homemade marinara sauce 5g better than most sugary sauce imo milk kroger carbmaster ultra filtered non fat original milk 3g i don't like the taste of nut milk and so drink this instead every so often chocolate lily's milk chocolate style salted caramel bar 2g i recommend this whole brand but i enjoy this product specifically sandwich bread outer aisle cauliflower sandwich thins 2g this is not bread but it great for when you want to make a sandwich can be used for mini pizza a well ice cream net carbs vary by flavor i've tried halo top enlightened rebel and other le known brand i'd say rebel is the best followed by enlightened followed by halo top halo top to me is more creamed ice than ice cream this is somewhat of a problem with all these brand but i'd say halo top ha the worst texture overall enlightened and rebel are both pretty good i gave the edge to rebel due to flavor choice being more to my liking i am actually going to try making my own ice cream soon which i'm sure will be better than all of these option still these are good to know for when you're lazy frozen product costco frozen broccoli 2g package come with 4 or so smaller bag of broccoli nuke the bag for 5 minute and season how you like and you have some really good broccoli on demand amp x200b i will add more to this list tomorrow amp maybe ongoing but i'm tired and wanted to get the thread started

severe crohn's amp autoimmune disorder are these food enough for keto a a preface i have a rare form of crohn's orofacialgranulomatosis or ofg for short it's teetering on the edge of developing into bowel crohn's but the condition inevitably develops regardless unless keto can stop this i also suffer from asthma hayfever coffee caffeine allergy and various other immune related illness i did keto for 6 month straight a couple of year back felt great but then relapsed due to the food i wa eating on keto conflicting with crohn's all that changed when a suspected heart attack i wa only 27 turned out to be severe heart inflammation caused by the mature cheese and cured meat i wa using a snack after that i've been eating clean meat dairy fat leafy green etc but constantly been in and out of illness fever etc long story short i've found the root of the problem year late coffee it ha seriously been messing me up to the point where i developed a fistula the dreaded beginning of crohn's it still hasn't been fixed after 2 year although the pandemic didn't help my question is am i able to live healthily on keto if my diet consists of meat leafy green like broccoli butter and pepper onion asparagus for flavouring i can add macadamia nut in too for a snack a they are well tolerated i have ketoaide supplemented to make up the minor shortcoming when it come to electrolyte too and the food itself is well salted each day ha around 100g of butter total added to meal in addition to using fatty meat such a chicken thigh and beef shin it's also the only way i can add variety by switching meat sorry for the long post but if i eat this way in addition to keeping on top of electrolyte and supplement i should be fine right symptom of my illness have reduced significantly since switching to clean fresh food and avoiding fermented product such a coffee and cured meat i just want to make sure i won't be killing myself by eating like this thank you in advance lovely people
